Reviews.Title: “Flawed Luxury, Low Value”
Reviews.Author: m6882
Reviews.Content: Notes from a six-day stay: Positive: beautiful situation, very comfortable rooms, luxurious public spaces, staff eager to please and very responsive to requests. Disappointing lapses in service execution and value: e.g., meal entree in Gazebo restaurant served too long after preparation; as a result it was tired, not fresh (crisp items not crisp, sauce separated, meal lukewarm, not hot; wine served not the one ordered. Very expensive ancillaries: 12 dollar (20TKL) unaccompanied cup of coffee, 67-dollar (120TKL!) standard (even if excellent) buffet breakfast, expensive informal restaurant (Gazebo)with limited choices (but beautiful views). We are used to staying at luxury hotels and don't expect bargains, but this pushes the envelope almost to the point of insult. The prices may explain why the hotel website does not include menus for its restaurants. Unacceptable: at checkout desk clerk said that he would remove erroneous minibar charge and didn't; separately was charged 18TKL for verbally reported last-night item that was listed on the minibar menu at 8TKL (and not inexpensive at that price). Perhaps I should have reviewed bill more carefully (I was in a bit of a hurry at checkout), but not correcting reported errors acknowledged while I was in the checkout process and dramatically overcharging, even if unintentional, is unacceptable and should not occur anywhere, let alone at a hotel of this class. We expect to pay for luxury, but we expect value and nearly perfect service. Next time, we will look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with wonderful staff, security and spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: Dallas_TXDebbie
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to Istanbul. The Ciragon Palace is a beautiful oasis right on the waterfront. Views from the restaurant overlooking the pool and grounds is fantastic. The location is great and easy to access. What I really appreciated was the high security within the hotel. I felt very safe as I was traveling alone. The rooms were spacious and the bathroom was very roomy. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “LUXURY - BUT LIMITED BY LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: DJHBedford
Reviews.Content: There is no doubt that this is a wonderful hotel. It is luxurious; has excellent service; enjoys a beautiful setting on the Bosphorous ; and delivers a high end experience. However we found its location had limitations. The only other 'hospitality facility' nearby is the Four Seasons Hotel; to reach relaxed bars and non-hotel dining opportunities always necessitated a taxi ride , bus or tram journey. Instead of capitalising on the opportunty this created, by delivering attractive solutions on property, the hotel was over formal for dining and the bar lacked ambiance.[ it probably feels easier in the summer when the poolside bar is operating] The hotel's choice of dining was too limited ; there was no 'coffee shop' option for easy snacks ; and the bar felt like something out of an old time movie. Although we tried these experiences we ended up taking 20 minute rides to find a more happening bar life and international dining. So , if you are looking for non-stop luxury and a truly 5 star hotel experience the Ciragan Palace is it; of you want to be more informal and to broaden your enjoyment of the destination its worth looking at alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pricy!!”
Reviews.Author: kathfas
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ciragan Palace Kempinski last June for four days. The hotel is absolutely stunning, with large, beautifully decorated rooms and bathrooms. The grounds are gorgeous with views of the Bosphorous as you lounge by the pools. Food is amazing, but very, very expensive. I believe I paid over 30 euros for a chicken caesar salad, 20 euros for a martini!!! The spa is also lovely, and I enjoyed a wonderful massage. If price is not a problem, you can't go wrong with the Kempinski, but otherwise I'm sure there are more reasonable places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Desertmadam
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, strong attention to detail and excellent service. Views are magnificent, close to buzzing Ortakoy/ Kurucesme and close enough to Taksim for those wanting more of a touristy vibe. Traffic is a nightmare so plan ahead, but when you're on the Bosphorous, do you really care? BIG plus is free (and excellent) wi-fi throughout the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful property on the bosphorus”
Reviews.Author: seeitall2010
Reviews.Content: superlative experience. the service at this hotel is superb. attentive and friendly, caring. everyone was so nice, especially to our children, which we greatly appreciated. the concierge was extremely helpful both with advice on what to see and how to get there, as well as for restaurants. our rooms were lovely and had partial views of the bosphorus. the property is immaculate. the outdoor areas on the water are epic, and the outdoor pool has to be one of the great pools. the only issue - it is very, very expensive. a bottle of water is more expensive than wine in the real world. breakfast buffet at 80 euros per adult is robbery frankly, tasty robbery, but still. great experience..would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel in istabul”
Reviews.Author: shima k
Reviews.Content: very nice,luxury and beautiful hotel,It had been a palace before and it's so nice to stay in kempinski,the location is also very good. but the only problem is that is a little pricy.

Reviews.Title: “magnificent view, mediocre spa”
Reviews.Author: ioanna_saiti
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very nice, the breakfast fabulous and the service excellent. However, the spa was much below my expectations for such a hotel, for example in the pool area there were left towels from other visitors and the personnel did not collect them. The atmosphere of the spa was not so original "turkish" as expected.

Reviews.Title: “for us number 1 in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: jhonnyhome
Reviews.Content: we stayed few times in istanbul , I started as student in 1967 visiting Istanbul, very very small cheap hotel , with roomservice by "Sudirman" who had a teahouse on the corner and for $0,04 bringing 2 turkish tea up (5th floor) Thereafter we visit many times Istanbul for business and relax , we think it is with rome , barcelona , amsterdam one of the best cities in Europe to visit. The breakfast was expenisive, but it was worthwile and we still remember it. The location was stunning , the spa beautifull and you have to feel that the otomaan ruler was in the same room as we were sleeping. It is not in the center, but you can walk to a small market close by and for the center you take a taxi. We stayed in swiss hotel , riz-carlton , ceylan etc and they were excellent and maybe better rooms or service ,but this was the one we remember the best.

Reviews.Title: “Just Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Antwerpengl
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights at the hotel for a business conference. The hotel is situated in an old sultan palace which has been restored to its former glory. The hotel itself is situated in an adjacent building but it is wonderfuly fitted into the old style palace. The reception is a personal welcome by a sort of hostess instead of endlessly waiting to be helped. Rooms are very spacious,I had an incredible view on the Bosphorous, furnished in the style of the hotel and has all amenities and more. You even have the possibility to buy some souvenirs from within your room. At night there is a down-turn service and you receive a complimentary newspaper. We had food in some of the restaurant which was very good and service impeccable. Breakfast means a 'huge' choice of all kinds of continental, turkish and asian food although I feel it is largely overcharged with 48 euro. All in all perfect hotel, perfect service !

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but very over priced”
Reviews.Author: Aardvark1963
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel well located by the Bosphorus but be wary that the awful local traffic can make the journey to the old city arduous, and many taxis refused to bring us back during the rush hour because of the traffic. The prices in the hotel are eye watering: no matter how good the breakfast â‚¬44 seems rather steep as does â‚¬300 for a 55 minute couples massage!

Reviews.Title: “Be a Sultan .. at least Once”
Reviews.Author: GhaziAlSayed
Reviews.Content: I fell in love with this hotel at first sight (or the first night). As advertised, It was originally a palace built during Sultan Abdulaziz days ( around year 1871) and it sure makes you feel luxury and originality ... Reception and Front desk staff were in the top of gentleness and good manners, and offered answeres for all my inquiries. Since I was on a business trip for ONE day .. I decided to stay in room to go over paperwork. The room was spacious and the furniture arranged carefully, with self-service corner packed with light Snacks. Self-service included Gents & Ladies gifts/accessories at a reasonable price (which I thought it is a great last-minute gift ( saves you from over prices items @ the airport) Hotel kept its line of of Ottoman style and modern-classic furniture. Since I am a fan of Ottoman Art, I have enjoyed every little detail in that room. Even the bed-side bottle of water was in a brass container full of details ... Art every where Unfortunately, I forget to keep the postcard with a picture of the Sultan , and sure will go back one day to get it ;)

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: sszimm
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a gorgeous setting on the Bosphorus, and provided a wonderful oasis from the crazy traffic and hustle/bustle of Istanbul. Our room was a corner room overlooking the bridge over the Bosphorus--amazing views day and night. The room itself was beautiful. And the hotel service was impeccable: friendly and pampering. Even the doorman was looking out for us when we came home one evening and he noticed that the taxi meter wasn't on--he wanted to make sure before we paid that we weren't getting ripped off. We also had tea one late afternoon, which was delicious, luxurious, and plentiful--definitely recommend you take advantage of being in the hotel and reserving time to do this (and given how pricey the rest of the hotel is, it's not that expensive). Our only complaint: breakfast, even just a cup of coffee, is crazy expensive. We splurged one day but otherwise couldn't justify spending $15 or so for a cup of coffee so we'd go to a cafe outside the hotel. Still, definitely would return anytime we get the opportunity!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious hotel”
Reviews.Author: Artem T
Reviews.Content: The stunning hotel with wonderful views of the Bosphorus. Magnificent territory with a wonderful heated swimming pool. I am very pleased that the staff allowed to swim in the outdoor pool all day and night, although there are signs with the restriction of time till 20:00. Excellent breakfasts! Especially I liked the bar with live jazz! The best cocktails and very professional bartender.

Reviews.Title: “True Style and Elegance”
Reviews.Author: KuwaitRanda
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel, its location right on the bosphorous Sea, Its Grand entrance, personal room check in, lovely ambiance, impeccable service, excellent meals, amiable staff. I can't say enough. Kempinski, well done.

Reviews.Title: “A must see hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: jaybirdlosangeles
Reviews.Content: This maybe the best hotel I have ever stayed at...service...food...ambience...room. The hotel overlooks the Bosphorous Sea..the buffet breakfast is wonderful. Unforgettable vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Wooww!!”
Reviews.Author: Phillip J
Reviews.Content: This is a unique hotel with amazing details! Choose the corner suite and enjoy the real Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel to stay!”
Reviews.Author: IreneAthens
Reviews.Content: No words can describe the beauty of this hotel. At first, its location, just by the Bosphorus. The rooms are spacious and luxury. But above all, the view of Bosphorus from the room. Spectacular! I enjoyed everything at this hotel, from the service, the breakfast, the excellent treatment at the Turkish bath. Unforgettable memories. I will definitely go back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Almost 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: pharmanuke
Reviews.Content: I'll admit I walked into this place thinking I would hate it. I tend to prefer quite modern hotels with spacious areas and a hip vibe, so I figured this would be a bit like my grandmother's living room - nice but all wrong for me. Alright, I was wrong. The place is phenomenal with just a couple drawbacks. First, the service is truly impeccable. From the moment you walk in to the moment you leave, every employee is not only dedicated to your needs, but they are also pleasant and manage not to appear in your face and omnipresent in an annoying way. Trust me - I'm comparing this to St Regis butler service and other premium offerings. It's great. Next, the spaces are shockingly well kept. All of the furniture in my room looked spanking new. And while the decor certainly wasn't my style, it was absolutely perfect for the setting. The bed was wonderful, bathroom great, etc. I got out of the shower one morning and found that the mirror had a three foot wide section, from top to bottom, centered directly over the sink, that was completely fog resistant. Nice. They thought of the little things. Restaurants were top notch. I was there for five nights evaluating an acquisition and ate in the hotel several times. Really exceptional cuisine, and as always exceptional service. The pool overlooking the bosphorus was heated. Why do I mention this? It was 34 degrees outside, but the pool was 83. Steam just poured off of the surface like a hot spring in Iceland. Can;t imagine what it costs to do that, but it made for a magnificent swimming experience. Why four stars? Well, at $500USD/night, a view of the valet station and taxi wating area isn;t so hot. The place is very expensive, and if you want a nice view, you are well north of $500 in a very small room. Another issue was the bar. While nice decor and skilled bartenders are great, there was some godawful perfume or fragance that was so overpowering I couldn't drink one night. Other nights were thick and unpleasant. But one night was literally so bad I couldn't physically breathe. Like getting teargassed. I was not alone. Truly a baffling issue for such a nice place. Either way, the hotel is great and it is located in a great area - Ortakoy. It is a non-touristy but fun area full of history and great food. Just walk north about half a mile and you are in the thick of it.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel with amazing views to Bosphorus. Excellent and unforgettable experience!”
Reviews.Author: Anna_Bella84
Reviews.Content: We spent wonderful 4 days in Ciragan Kempinski. We had Superior Bosphorus view room which was spacious, clean and with spectacular view to the hotel area and the Bosphorus. That was an unforgettable stay where everything was on a highest level â€“ room, service, food and ambiance. We enjoyed every minute being in the hotel, feeling real luxury and individual approach. The breakfast and outdoor infinity pool - something indescribable. I definitely would love to return and I recommend Ciragan Kempinski to people who are looking for a real luxury stay of high standard.

Reviews.Title: “Dont waste your money, go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: bouji
Reviews.Content: Please don't be fool by the beautiful pictures of the palace. The hotel is the ugly 70s building next door, although to be fair the rooms are quite spacious, if a little dated. Ruinosly expensive to eat. Really ran down spa which charges outrageous prices. Service at the reception and restaurant seems a liitle but lost, but at least they at trying. The really sad thing about this hotel that the Palac part has the potential to be one of the most beautiful hotels in the world, but insted they completely ruined the inside of the building with the cheap decor. This place demands marble and antiques, but you get cheap fittings and cheap furniture. At most 3 star look inside, 5 star look outside. I really hope someone buys it and restores to the former glory, this place really deserves it! P.S. Dont be fooled by all 5 stars reviews, they are conference crowd. Anyone who pays from their own pocket is bound to be disappointed by the hotel and amazed by the beauty of its location and outside of the palace.

Reviews.Title: “The best view of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Andrea T
Reviews.Content: Istanbul is one of the most magnificent cities of the world. Ciragan Palace is a very good reason to visit Istanbul. It is a First Class hotel, with all the amenities of a Palace and with an breathtaking view to the Bosporus! In order to avoid any surprises, ask for a Superior Bosporus View room or a suite in order to enjoy the magnificent view. The rooms have a very good size, most of them have a balcony with a view to the Palace, to the pool and of course to the Anatolian side of Istanbul. The service is very good; from the door mans to the check-in and from the room service to the outlets every employee of Ciragan knows how to make your trip wonderful! Enjoy the traditional Turkish breakfast, although it is a little too much of food, and do not miss the chance to have a dinner in the side of the Palace in the unique Turkish fine-dining restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive and challenging location, amazing customer service”
Reviews.Author: Ms_OffTheBeatenPath
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel for a short stay; the old palace is beautiful, the customer service is exceptional, and the entire place is impeccably clean. The rooms are nicely appointed, and the highlight is the 5 piece bathroom. A view of the Bosphorus is very nice, but I am not certain it is worth and extra 90 Euro a night. We were here as part of a business trip and the business facilities were very nice and well maintained. The hotel had two very significant draw-backs: a) For individuals wanting to explore Istanbul, the distance from Sultanamet, and the majority of the tourist attraction (Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia, Hippodrome etc) was a detraction - a very unpleasant 25 minute cab ride (beware of corrupt taxi drivers) made it difficult to hop in and out of the hotel, and b) the hotel did not have any convenience type shops, which meant having to leave the grounds to pick up items like sodas and light snacks, or affordable (light and simple) breakfasts. While I appreciate that this is a very high end establishment, I would still appreciate a small shop for sundry items. Laledan and Turga were very good - excellent service, very good food. Room service on the other hand was VERY overpriced and disappointingly mediocre, even down right bad. So while I believe the hotel is certainly worth a (short-term) visit, I do not think I would return.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in Eurasia!”
Reviews.Author: Manos_LHR
Reviews.Content: What can I say about this hotel?? Everything was as luxury hospitality services should be in every hotel!!! Turkey is famous for its tourism yet overall the country is far behind a proper star rating system whith many proclaimed 5 stars to be proven to be 4 stars at least. Ciragan Palace though is not only an exception but a bright example for hoteliers all over Europe on how luxury services are offered!! The ""new" building is relatively old with the decadent othoman additions in design being evident in all the wings (kitch gold and silver and coloured glasses etc) but in Ciragan this is an enjoyment and in Istanbul this is a trade mark and part of the experience! I had a Bosphorus view room which was spacious and clean yet as decadent but this is something you like or hate I position the room's style as part of the experience as my likes are more minimal. What can I say about the breakfast and the breakfast room, the super helpful staff, the brialliant tastes in the restaurant and the best massage ever. The outdoor pool area is fab the indoor pool area is a bit less than expected. The outdoors of the Cirgana Palace are just magnifiscent with the old palace section to be the main jewel of the hotel. This is definately Istanbul's landmark hotel and would definately visit again and recommend it by all means!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a truly amazing city!”
Reviews.Author: Franktravelstheworld
Reviews.Content: The hotel is incredible, very nice infinity pool an service.. Great place.. Shame I couldnt spend more time in the hotel as had so much to see in Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “What a fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: pitliver
Reviews.Content: I have been meaning to write this for some time.... Our stay was at the start of our Orient Express trip to Venice. Our room and service was fantastic. Breakfast has got to be the best buffet breakfast and location anywhere in the World! If I have any 'slight' negatives to report the would be the price of a Herdricks Gin and tonic!!...and perhaps the impersonal attitude of just 'some' staff. Otherwise...one of the World's 'must stay at' Hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding EVERYTHING, A simply Magnificent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan H
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on several occasions and it is just OUTSTANDING! From the greeting at the front door, the magnificent breakfasts, the fabulous hot chocolate afternoon teas in the opulent tea room overlooking the Bosphorus. The rooms are clean, comfortable and well appointed. The staff are well trained attentive and NOTHING is too much effort. We had special dietary requirements and the Kitchen staff were helpful and understanding of our requirements, which frankly must have seemed bizarre to them! Probably in my top ten in the world and definitely in my top 50. You will have a great time in this hotel whether it is business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: technoelectra
Reviews.Content: I was so exited to hear this is where they filmed a recent james bond. Super elegant and high class. The building was breathtaking. Stay in the main hotel if you want to see people and action. If you want q quite desolate building, stay in the palace part. Beautiful for a Turkish coffee and watching boats down the river

Reviews.Title: “Stunning”
Reviews.Author: NYCDesign78
Reviews.Content: The setting is absolutely magical and the service was exceptional. We were there in winter but it was still wonderful to walk along the Bosphorus in front of the stunning palace. Stopped by the Sultanahmet Four Seasons - it's pretty and centrally located but boring. Stopped at the Four Seasons on the Bosphorus - all the rooms face into a courtyard and no balconies. What is the point of being on the Bophorus if you never get to see it!?!? Rooms were a lovely size and the balconies were amazing to have.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice indeed”
Reviews.Author: mchendra
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest hotel. Very luxurious, very detail, not to mention it has a wonderful view as being located precisely on the bay of bosphorus sea. I book the garden view room, was upgraded because it was my birthday when i checked in to the hotel. It was late when we arrive, they sent me a birthday cake the next day. It was a wonderful surprise. How very nice of them. Oo, the cake was delicious btw. I don't have a sweet tooth but i had a lot of this because i can't stop eating them. The concierge has a wonderful knowledge of the city. Helping me with my itnerary for the day, the whole trip in fact. It is unfortunate i can only stay for 3 nights. Been away from home for too long. We will definitely stay here again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Experience at Ciragan”
Reviews.Author: jimmysi
Reviews.Content: I recently spent four nights in Istanbul at Ciragan and it was an experience I'd happily repeat. The service was top notch from check in (they gave me my room much earlier than check in time, which they didn't have to do) to check out. I was there for a work event which was also handled flawlessly. I would give this hotel a 'five' if it weren't for a pattern that seemed pervasive with me and my group of trying to palm off one of the worst rooms in the hotel on us (literally happened to each of us as we all arrived on separate dates)...we had booked "Park View" rooms which you should be warned do not look out onto a park at all, but rather a noisy road. Book yourselves the Bosphorus view rooms as they're much quieter and really the charm of the hotel is it's location on the water. My original room didn't even view the Park but a cement wall on the driveway...the front desk manager promptly changed my room once I complained. That little glitch notwithstanding, the service is really nice at this hotel. Front desk and concierge staff quickly started calling me by name and the car service, while expensive, was first rate. Even in cooler months it's nice to have a coffee outside under the heaters if it's a sunny day. Our work event was also handled flawlessly in the Palace section (there was another huge event going on that night but you'd never have known it)...the hotel is the newer structure and the 'Palace' is used for events. I understand there's a nice spa but I didn't get a chance to use it sadly. I'd love to go back for a personal trip and when I do I'll return to this nice hotel. (Incidentally my upgraded room was I think 448...it was on the ground floor but these are rather nice rooms as they have private terraces, are quiet and have high ceilings)

Reviews.Title: “The best of the best”
Reviews.Author: danieldenoto
Reviews.Content: If you're going for a romantic journey to Istanbul this is the place for you because of the service, the quality of the rooms, the view over the Asia and of course the Bosphorous and least but not last the marvelous breakfast you can eat seated on the terrace. If you look for turkish food go to the old palace where you will be delighted by a nice atmosphere with good food and a very good variety of world wines. After the dinner take a breath on the little romantic terrace face to the Bosphorous.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worth it..”
Reviews.Author: fabbas
Reviews.Content: Top quality hotel with good food, excellent rooms, view and service.

Reviews.Title: “great location fabulous food and service”
Reviews.Author: patentattorney
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 days here this year in September and it was truly memorable. A true 5 star hotel.The staff were very helpful and friendly,the food was outstanding in all restaurants and the position of the hotel was stunning. This hotel is not near the old town but its worth staying here as the centre of town is hectic and the hotel provides a relaxing haven away from it all.You can walk to Ortakoy where there is a night market and restaurants with a great atmosphere. The traffic is terrible in Istanbul so we went on the tram which was surprisingly simple an very cheap. Try it you will not be disappointed but remember 5 star hotels anywhere are not cheap!!

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Elyse1219
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gorgeous. Our room faced the Bosphorus sea and Asia and the beautiful bridge that changes colors. Infinity pool, amazing spa and Hammam. Do it . Quite an experience. We ended our Greek island and Turkey cruise with 3 or4 nights here. Close to everything whether cabbing or the Metro which we found to eliminate the traffic. Wonderfully friendly people everywhere. We had breakfast looking out at the sea, very comfortable dining room. Exquisite architecture. Gorgeous suite. We dined at the actual palace next door. A world first class hotel with service to match. One of the top ten In Europe. Go.

Reviews.Title: “Palace on the Bosphorus”
Reviews.Author: Jude2410
Reviews.Content: a great Kempinski property. Bang on the Bosphorus, looking across at Asia, walking distance to bridge and night market. Great breakfast spread, with nice oudoor seating. Great place to relax in the evening. Quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: gaby557
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the best and friendliest service of any hotel I've stayed at in Ä°stanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Expect nothing less”
Reviews.Author: gokhanHk
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a unique ambiance, you are staying in a palace, and you are feeling like an Ottoman Sultan deep in your heart. Staff are welcoming and service is nearly perfect which is not a bad thing to complain. Check in process is successfull and comforting. Hotel is right on the Bosphorus shorewith sights of Asia on the other shore. I would definitely recommend everyone to spend some time at this hotel for.

Reviews.Title: “Floating in the Infinity Pool on the edge the Bosporus in the moonlit fog listening to the cry of the Muezzin”
Reviews.Author: jamesjseltzer
Reviews.Content: THE place to stay in Istanbul. The Grand Sultan's suite with views of both the courtyard/pools and of the Bosporus is fantastic. Try it for two nights and then move to a "normal" suite. The breakfast buffet is the best breakfast buffet in Turkey.! It compares favorably with the luncheon seafood buffet at the Eden Roc in Cap D'Antibes and far surpasses in quality the repetitious offerings of the typical 5 star hotel. The architecture is genuine - the services are only adequate and the hotel "fine dining" restaurant is just average. But the breakfast buffet is not to be missed. Helicopter transit between the airport and the hotel is excellent. Take a trip to Cappodocia in Central Anatolia and take a balloon ride. I missed this because of inclement weather. Rent a private motor yacht. The hotel will arrange it. (also - don't wear any expensive jewelry even within the hotel. Leave Harry W. and P. Phillippe safely ensconced in the Hotel Safe in the Lobby!) I sailed down the Sea of Marmara then down the Bosporus to the Black Sea(Î˜Î¬Î»Î±ÏƒÏƒÎ± Ï„Î¿Ï… ÎœÎ±Ï�Î¼Î±Ï�Î¬) , separates the two continents. Decent Beluga is available although the blinis were clinically depressed. I stayed at the hotel for 10 days and saw all of Istanbul. There are other great hotels. My friends and neighbors, Jan and Peter,who are world travelers and live in Belvedere, California, who have stayed at the Ciragan Palace, also liked the Peninsula Sultanahmet because of its historical location.

Reviews.Title: “Five star, but a little over the top”
Reviews.Author: Richard G
Reviews.Content: The most expensive hotel I've ever paid for. Perfectly nice, as you'd expect, but a little over the top. We checked in at about 3pm, and wanted to leave our stuff and rush off immediately (to the WTA tennis championships, the reason for being in Istanbul). Because check in had to be done by a dedicated helper-person, it took far too long if you're in a hurry (most people there aren't). Hotel is very large, which I don't like, most of the clientele are old (I suppose they're the only ones who can afford it). Breakfast was decent, but fell below my expectations for such a pricey place. Lots of security (including bag scanner at the door, and a one-car-at-a-time process outside). I guess these days this should make us all feel 'safe' but it had the opposite effect on me, as I felt it made it obvious that the hotel considers itself a target. Service perfect, beautiful views and a beautiful hotel, but I preferred the Four Seasons next door (same view, smaller, all round more pleasant).

Reviews.Title: “Deservedly five star”
Reviews.Author: Murat N
Reviews.Content: I met my wife here and have been coming back once a year ever since. The hotel is just superb . Full on luxury ,specially around the reception here. We have tried many rooms over the years certainly the Bousphorus facing ones are more relaxing ,garden view a little noisy. Last time we visited we stayed in the palace side with a view overlooking the Bosphorus. Unforgettable. Breakfast in Lalely is a must try ,I enjoy drinking my Turkish tea while watching the ships sail by just 50 meters away. I found Tugra restaurant a little disappointing . I understand it's an International restaurant and has to cater to all tastes. But if I go to a Turkish restaurant I expect Turkish food not international. Just as if I went to a Chinese I would expect Chinese food. But overall excellent.

Reviews.Title: “True luxury!!”
Reviews.Author: drtw2503
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in some very nice hotels, I was skeptical about the "build-up" for this property. Foolish me! Everything I heard and more was true! Room was superb - nicely appointed and a good size. Staff is beyond anything I have ever experienced. Was met at the front door by a personal check-in agent and quickly taken to MY ROOM to complete the check in process. Restaurants and Gazebo lounge overlook the Bosporous. Think of something and the staff will be doing it before you complete the thought! Choice of pillow type in all rooms. Maids worked around our very crazy schedule. Security was best I've ever experienced without being intrusive to the guests. Just can't say enough good about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Feel like the Sultan”
Reviews.Author: WIsil
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a former palace that has been redone recently, sitting right on the Bosphorus. The views are amazing. There is an outdoor pavilion called the Sultans Pavillion which you can relax in, get drinks, and completely soak up the atmosphere. Warning - a glass of wine will set you back about $40 and that is for basic wine, nothing too special. All in all, it is a great way to spend an evening.

Reviews.Title: “A Convenient and Luxurious Base in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: OttawaSenshotelier
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with the service from start to finish at this beautiful hotel. A lot of care has been taken in ensuring that employees are well-trained, respectful and service-orientated. Lots of great personalities among the members of staff, including the Chief Concierge Cenghis (sp?), Lobby Lounge Manager and breakfast restaurant hostess. Travelling in a party of 7, the arrangements were superb and requests were accommodated with grace and style. Turga restaurant was terrific and we very much enjoyed selecting from the traditional Ottoman menu. The doorman Engin twice assisted with negotiating a better taxi price after being overcharged (many taxi drivers around Sultan Ahmet Mosque, Aya Sophia and Basilica Sisterns take advantage of tourists). To get into the old part of Istanbul it was easier to take a taxi from the hotel to Kavatas, then the tramway train across the Galata bridge - cheaper and a real time saver. To return, it's much easier (and scenic) to take the ferry back to Besiktas, then walk 10min back to the hotel. Great tips from Concierge. The view from the room was terrific, overlooking the hotel's patio/pool, the Bosphorus, Asian side and Topkapi Palace and Aya Sophia. Great soundproofing and a very restful sleep. This was a real treat. The city itself is marvellous and the hotel very much complimented and enhanced our overall experience. Thank you so much!

Reviews.Title: “Elite”
Reviews.Author: sgolyan
Reviews.Content: It was quiet an experience staying here. The hotel was very nice and the service excellent. No complains. Just that with our 'not so elite' holiday attire, we kind of felt out of place. On hindsight, i would not want to stay in such a hotel for a holiday with my wife. Maybe when we are old, but not now. This hotel would be great for business travelers or mature travelers. Would not recommend so much for young, fun loving people.

Reviews.Title: “very cold and unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: Lana X
Reviews.Content: Ive booked standard room in this hotel for several nights. After my arrival hotel asked me to wait 30-40min when they will clean my room.Same time they announce me that my reservation was upgraded from standard room to suite. One person from staff bring me to restaurant and provide free drink.So,the start was very positively promising. After 1h i returned to reception asking to check in.They asked me to wait 30min more. After 50min i returned back to reception again.They start to sing the same song that room still cleaning!!!!!Imagine my mood!!So,i decided to call general manager and went to see what must be so special in my room that cleaning process continue more than 2h! Ive seen 2 men was cleaning my room.So, they promised to finished in 10min in what i believed. Finally ,after 2h30min i checked in. Suite was big with direct view to Bosphorus.But the building created in not smart way.The view from suit that cost 1000euro per night was blocked from both side. only direct view to Bosphorus. Positive points: impressive huge breakfast(the most variation of dishes and most expensive). Perfect location!!!! Excellent swimming pool. Very very good massages made by females in spa area and on open area.Very beautiful old palace nearby with exclusive suites decorated with antic furniture. Very good security. Negative points: my friend drive me to hotel and was nearby during check in.So,for all my questions that i delivered to receptionist male or to female admin they not respond to me directly,but to my friend.So,imagine-iam looking directly to person from reception and she/he turned away from me and answered to my my friend.Don't know,maybe its in turkish traditions,but i never ever faced same things at any other hotels in Turkey. Very very cold staff behavior.They polite,but thats it! When i went to hamam for massage and scrubbing,i was totally shocked by behavior of man doing this job!!!! Ive visited many hamams in my life from 3 to 5* hotels.Nobody ever let themselves to try sexually abused customer!!!!Its happened only here! Tourists pays so much money for stay in most famous hotel of Istanbul and to be treated very unrespectably by massage therapist.After his several try to touch intime places that mustn't been treated this way left with scandal.Maybe some ladies came to this place specially for this "SPECIAL TREATMENT" and this man was used to it! But NOT ME!!! My conclusion was-never again to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Renee B
Reviews.Content: This is a large hotel but very comfortable. We used our AMX platium card to book our reservations and were given an upgraded room facing the Bosphorus, plus an 85Euro credit in the hotel. Beautiful breakfast on the patio was a great way to start your day, included in room. Room was large and plenty of room to hang clothes. The service was fast and very polite. The only draw back is the traffic getting to and from the hotel. The frontal road was a mess often taking 45 minutes for a 10 minute drive. My husband enjoyed the special cigar bar..

Reviews.Title: “Elegance in classy style”
Reviews.Author: ZoranG
Reviews.Content: Our stay took place at the end of September. Hotel was fully occupied and lot of company meetings have been in hotel spaces. Location on Bosphorus and the view from hotel is beautiful. Outdor swimming pool and area around it is very nice and morning breakfast on terrace is breathtaking. Buffet breakfast is rich with 250 different types of food. Really special experiance.

Reviews.Title: “Pricy but Worth It!”
Reviews.Author: Little B
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the beautiful Ciragan. My travel agent spoke highly of this hotel and they didn't disappoint! The first room we were given was without a Bosphorous view as we had been promised, but we were accomodated quickly with another room with a gorgeous view. The hotel caters to an international crowd and diplomats were there in full force.( All guests who enter must have their belongings scanned by security). The restaurant is excellent and I highly recommend the breakfast buffet-- predominately organic foods representing every conceivable ethnic and regional food culture imaginable. The wait staff is congenial but, by American standards, often times slow. The pool is beautiful and the cigar bar is a nightime must!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: munmunmun
Reviews.Content: Had a woderful three night stay. Staff were all helpful and pleasant. Breackfast buffet is the bigest and best I have ever seen. Terrace restaurant is a wonderful setting for an evening meal. Altogether a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Wedding show included”
Reviews.Author: AhasverSaoPaulo
Reviews.Content: One of the most beautifully located hotels in the world, located right at the Bosporus. When you chill out in your pool chair it looks as if the pool and the Bosporus are one. The hotel rooms are spacious but make sure to get one with a Bosporus view - the street side rooms have no view at all. Fro check-in you don't have to stand at the counter but a friendly lady will take you to a nice sitting area and do all the work for you. The hotel is actually not located inside the palace but is a modern concrete building connected to it. It has various restaurants and we tried them all. We had a barbecue dinner with a great buffet right next to the pool bar under starry skies; dinner at the Gazebo (both indoor and outdoor seating; very good food quality ) and at their top-of-the line Tugra restaurant located in the gorgeous palace itself. We had a table on the veranda (Bosporus view) and the icing on the cake was a wedding party right below us with the fireworks right in front of us (all inclusive, no mark-up), not to mention the ballet dancers and the Dean Martin imitation. The gym was not as comprehensively equipped as could be expected from a hotel of this class. There is a Spa next to it that seems to be staffed mostly by Thai masseuses. My wife went and had great praise for their skills. One special tip: the palace is very popular as a wedding site so look out for the pertinent preparations. You might get a great photo-op for free! (in one wedding, the bride arrive in a gilded barge... Almost like the Lohengrin opera... The groom chose a more contemporary form of arrival - by helicopter

Reviews.Title: “Beauty of Istanbul awesome ...”
Reviews.Author: butch54
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel last year with my ex gal...Amazing beautiful place city Istanbul,,great art.Anyway abt hotel its amazing I love to say it is one of the best hotels I stayed . We stayed in suite called sultan,,wonderful decorated nice lightning nice furniture ,,great bathroom..Spacious simply awesome..hammam which is famous in Istanbul tat also u get in the suite,,also rain bath amazing architect..lcd in bathroom wat more u expect frm a bathroom..Awesome view of city from room. Must chk out the suites..They got best spa & Turkish Hammam if u miss it tan ur visit is not over ...1 thing for sure u will love the magnificent view..excellent hospitality so wat u pay u get it .They got some great tea I don't like tea but here it was excellent..nice pool ..The restaurants are best in the city,highly recommended taste the local cuisines yes gastronomical but delicious nice bar ..their is nice romantic restaurant don't miss it & for breakfast another restaurant its wonderful the view decoration food service. Pay to enjoy leisure facilities u won't regret it at all.Perfect location not like its far from city or crowded just perfect place to relax..if in Istanbul Ciragan is the place to stay infect I m going to visit again soon..I recommend this hotel for singles couples everyone for every one their is something so thumbs up enjoy like the manager said sultan style we treat our customers they really do..don't miss it.

Reviews.Title: “One of a kind, luxury, amazing Bosporus View!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelerZV
Reviews.Content: First you definitely should and must stay at this hotel because of its magnificient view, excellent food, hospitality, service, spa and Turkish hamam, and many more. They have the best spa and Turkish hamam in town! Best, luxurious brunch and breakfast and many more.They have an excellent high tea in the afternoon as well. Rooms are spacious, bathrooms are marble. If you go during the summer season they have a very nice outdoor pool too. Even if you do not stay at Ciragan you should try one of its restraunts, they have excellent service and a great food. Overall I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in the world!”
Reviews.Author: Melb-daisy
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we could only stay one night in this hotel but it was an experience we will never forget. The setting is beautiful next to the busy Bosphorus river. The service at this hotel is amazing. Cannot wait to return to Istanbul and Ciragan Palace one day.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing!”
Reviews.Author: ash318
Reviews.Content: The service was top knotch. They knew our names the minute we walked in and the check in, at the room, was a super nice touch. We were staying in the newer wing, not the Palace suites. The infinity pool was breadthtaking. Dinner at Turka, even if you don't stay they is a MUST! They were most accomodation to our various requests and we even got to see a wedding from the balcony of Turka, as we ate our dinner. Had a private event there May 2011, for 150 people- it was just the best!

Reviews.Title: “Its not a palace at all”
Reviews.Author: yusuf41
Reviews.Content: Dont be misled, this hotel is just another average 5 star hotel located next door to the real Ciragan palace. You will not get a room in the palace unlecc you book the Palace suite or the Sultan Suite ! The picture on the hotel website shows the real palce next door and bot the actual hotel building . The location is not the best in Istanbul either, its far away from most tourist attractions and is difficult to access because of huge traffic problems in the area. The nice thing is that it it located on the banks of the Bosphorous and the views are really great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice!”
Reviews.Author: Carmo_Brasil
Reviews.Content: The front desk was efficient and friendly. We receive a good up grade, for a large suite with a Bosforus view. The bathrooms amenities was Monton Brown. The Breakfast was really good, the best one. The concierge was not friendly. In Istanbul nothing is complete when you not stay in Ciragan. I'm travel agent and I am check everything, trust me.

Reviews.Title: “Thinks its grandeur and location is all that is required”
Reviews.Author: MMPJ1956
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a superb location and view. The residential component of the hotel is not architecurally as grand as the adjacent 'palace'. Our room (superior sea view) was internationally smart, with a view of the Bosphorus. However the adjacent balconies all looked straight into our room. The staff were condescending and unfriendly. The food was not good and very expensive. Our dinner bill was totally incorrect. This is a large, international, impersonal hotel that has tabs on itself - only saved by its location/view.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Luxury!”
Reviews.Author: Prithie
Reviews.Content: My first stay at a Kempinski hotel and I was truly impressed. What impressed me most was the breakfast spread-the fact that almost 80 % is organic and the magnificent presentation. The check in was so personalised-not the usual desk check ins that I have experienced at other hotels and we did not have to wait for our room which was really appreciated as we'd just come off a cruise ship. The concierge and travel desk were indeed helpful in terms of getting around the city and the availability of taxis was great. The setting and gardens of this hotel has to be seen to be believed. I truly felt like royalty here. Probably the second most impressive aspect of this hotel-that soft and luxurious bed with all the pillows....which made getting up in the morning so diificult....but then I had the splendid breakfast to look forward to! Last but not least-the goodbyes when we left and the smiley faces telling us to come back to this lovely hotel and Istanbul shortly. We ill definitely take them up on that! One of the finest hotels in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Just amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Spottyonetwo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is tops! Check in was effortless and quick with wonderful service. Bell men appeared from behind walls - or so it seemed - and spirited our luggage away! Beautiful lobby with nice seating area. Our room was water facing, and what a view! Definitely worth the extra to have the view. The room itself was okay. Getting old with need for a bit of a redo. Small TV - (very unusual for a hotel of that caliber!) Great comfortable bed with spotless linens. Two armchairs with small table and desk. Each day there was a different treat left for us. Always three pieces of fruit, with turkish delight, cookies, or chocolate truffles. As well as bottles of water. Nice to come back to after a hot day of sightseeing! The bathroom was great, with in tub shower with two different heads, as well as a bidet and good quality toiletries which were replenished each day. Continental breakfast was included in our rate. We ate this each morning, out on the patio overlooking the pool and water. The breakfast could have kept us going all day. We checked out the buffet breakfast in the other restaurant and the selection was enormous. The only issue we had was that we wished we could have spent another day at this wonderful hotel to just lie at the pool and be pampered!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice pool”
Reviews.Author: CUBBEAR07
Reviews.Content: I liked the view and the pool. Gym was good enough. This hotel was like a business hotel. I did not feel like I am on vacation when I was seeing all those people in business outfits. Service was good and fast. I agree with the previous reviewer yes they disturb you in the room very often. They should let us to sleep. If I fly for 15 hours I think I can sleep until 4pm. And I think it is ok to not make my bed that day. This hotel is a luxury place. If you are on a low budget this is not for you. But if you want to stay in the hotel a few days and spoil yourself this is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Old Worl Charm.. Excellent...”
Reviews.Author: MikeyR
Reviews.Content: It is always a pleasure staying at this hotel. Over the last year I've stayed four times at the CPKI, both in the main hotel building and at the suites/palace. And have not been disappointed. The facility is sprawling, and a lot of walking is needed, great choice of restaurants, especially for breakfast. The rooms are good sized, well appointed, and the butler serivce if you try the Suites/Palace is superb. I really can't fault this place. Well, I can, it is very expensive...But worth it..

Reviews.Title: “it was ok but i wouldnt visit again”
Reviews.Author: paulscottcoombs
Reviews.Content: The rooms are a good size, clean staff are very helpful but the room decor left a lot to be desired. Having paid 2000 dollars per night I was expecting a great room, what i recieved was a basic room by the least. I couldnt move rooms because the hotel was fully booked. On the plus side the hotel it self was beautiful but the rooms need upgrading asap

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WyeRiver
Reviews.Content: Classic river front property with great facilities. Somewhat lacking a good bar to have a beer at apart from around the pool. Rooms all good, service good, and location is great if you want to be by the river. Turn right out the front of the hotel and walk for 10 minutes to find market stalls and plenty of well priced restaurants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: rubyrockNy
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, with spectacular pool(s overlooking The Bospherous River. This is a died and went to heaven resort. Makes The Ritz and 4 Seasons looks shabby, esp the The Ritz because it is not on the water. This place is gorgeous. Our only complaint? $25 for a glass of iced coffee. Nice rooms, nice gym.

Reviews.Title: “A Memorable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Athens_GreeceTina
Reviews.Content: We chose to visit Ciragan Palace in June 2011 to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We enjoyed every minute of our stay in a fabulous room overlooking Bosphorus. The service was excellent, the personnel helpful and charming, the view magnificent, the pool amazing, the food delicious, everything was breathtaking ........... It was worth every euro..... Thank you Kempinski Ciragan Palace, I hope we will be back soon !!!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect escape!”
Reviews.Author: materialboi
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I was a bit worried booking my stay here since most reviews make it sound like the hotel is so far out of the way. I am so happy that I booked here, I felt it was pretty much centrally located and easy to get to wherever you want to go! Traffic is a problem in IStanbul so really where ever you stay you will be waiting in traffic jams. It was a great place to come back to night after night. As for the property, the pictures do not do it justice and the staff is what you expect from a hotel of this caliber, extremely attentive and will accommodate any request! I will not stay anywhere else upon my return to Istanbul. The pool was fantastic and again the pool staff was there for any request but never in your face. Cannot wait to come back to Turkey and this fantastic hotel! Oh and btw the TVs are old but if you are coming to this hotel to watch TV then your missing the whole point of a vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely 1st class”
Reviews.Author: MJN
Reviews.Content: This is a real treat away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Yes, it takes a while to get to and from the Grand Bazaar and the Blue Mosque given the traffic jams all over Istanbul, but the peace and quiet of the hotel, the very nice rooms and the great view let you relax and recover afterwards. The gym is large, the spa fantastic and the food, both quality and selection, superb. The breakfast buffet is the largest and most diverse I have ever seen and is worth splurging out. Like this, everything else does come at a price so, and especially the continental breakfast is NOT worth the money (walk the 10min to the square next to the mosque in Ortakoy instead).

Reviews.Title: “Needed oasis in this city”
Reviews.Author: rmcknewyorkcity
Reviews.Content: We are from NYC, so are used to the hustle of large cities, but Istanbul takes city hassle to a new level. Traffic, crowds and smells are all bigger in this great city. The Ciragan is postitioned perfectly to give you a break from touring the city. The views over the Bosphorus, pool, grounds and buildings are on par with the best anywhere. The hotel looks from outside to be more grand and opulent than the 4 seasons next door, which looked kind of 60s-ish from the outside. Staff was always helpful and accessable. The morning breakfast was probably the best we have had. Certainly best variety. Definitely spend the money to get a Bosphorus facing view.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Average service. Bad food.”
Reviews.Author: RafalA
Reviews.Content: Staying at the fabulously located Kempinski hotel in Istanbul was interesting. The views were breathtaking as was the pool right by the Bosphorus. On the other hand, the food was terrible, and the â€žDo Not Disturbâ€� sign there apparently means â€žCall every half an hourâ€� :))).

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: travel8nyc
Reviews.Content: First time in Istanbul and had a great time at the Ciragan. We did not get a room that faced the Bosphorus but the noise level was not bad. The room was smaller and darker than I had hoped but we did not spend too much time in the room. Positives: - Great pool - Helpful staff - Room: love the daily treats they leave you, particularly the powdered chocolate truffles - Beautiful grounds, took some great pictures on the palace side Negatives: - Small outdated TV in hotel room - Dark, small room that faced street side - Prices for food and drinks are way above other luxury hotels that I have stayed at though that appears to be the case for most of the nice places in Istanbul. Suggestions for other restaurants <10 min walk from the hotel: - House Cafe - Zuma

Reviews.Title: “dazzling property”
Reviews.Author: sunsfanatic
Reviews.Content: This was a magical hotel with beautiful rooms and great views if you splurge for a Bosphorus view. Service and food were top drawer .The property is simply magnificent. The room was huge with all amenities excellent. Agreed the tariff is not cheap and it is not near the major tourist sites south of the Golden Horn, BUT, if you have seen them on a previous Istanbul visit, or have a private tour with transport, staying on the water in a fabulous resort can not be beaten. Airport transportation with check in assistance once you get there was a big help. My only recommendations for improvement are 1) for the price rooms should have flat screen tvs and 2) the beautiful outdoor pools should be heated (it was 76F) even though there was an indoor pool at 90F because with the setting of the outdoor pool and the view, who wants to be indoors!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice with a few reservations.....”
Reviews.Author: MickiD
Reviews.Content: We selected the Ciragan Palace Kempinski after considering the trade offs of various locations, and we would make the same decision again. It was a pleasure to return to the hotel after a long, hot day of touring and unwind on our balcony overlooking the magnificent gardens, pool and Bosphorus. That said, however, with the heavy traffic, getting to and from the major sites could be a nuisance and the hotel is not in easy walking distance of restaurants, etc., so one was captive to the hotel and its high prices. We were able to walk to a few restaurants, but the sidewalk was narrow, crowded and bumpy, so "easy" is the operative word here. Our suite in the new building was comfortable, but probably not worth the incremental cost. There was a shortage of shelves/drawers for storage in the luggage closet, so we had to either hang things or live out of our suitcases. Further, the room always looked messy, with all kinds of brochures and pamphlets scattered about. There were six pillows on the bed, of three different densities, so everyone can probably pick a winner. Our balcony was no bigger than that for standard rooms, so being in a suite offered no advantage in that regard. The furnishings were fine and the bathroom was lovely, but nothing exceptional. It is important to book a room on the Bosphorus side of the hotel, as the rooms in front are likely noisy as they look on to a very busy street. The breakfast buffet - try to get a rate that includes this - was spectacular, one of the best we have encountered. Everything on site is expensive, with a 55 minute massage at 200 Euros. The pool is one of the best features of this property. There are plenty of chairs, good service and magnificent views. As noted by several previous reviewers, this is not a warm, feel good kind of hotel. The service, while good, is workmanlike and efficient and it's unlikely that many staff members will know your name or create the cosseted feeling experienced in many hotels of similar stature. There was a huge convention at the hotel while we were there, and I suspect this is common. It did not disturb us in any way, but the milling in the lobby and name tags created a sterile atmosphere. There was free wireless service throughout the hotel, which was a much appreciated amenity. We would stay at this hotel again, but consideration should be given to the eye popping prices and distance from central visitor sites. On balance, we enjoyed the comfort and serenity at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Noisy rooms (garden view)”
Reviews.Author: Matilde_Novaes
Reviews.Content: Never ask for the rooms that are facing the street ( garden view) because they are extremly noisy They DONT HAVE DOUBLLE glass windows so you will have the sensation that the Ambulance who is passing by is inside your room. Impossible to sleep. We had to ask the hotel to change us to a room facing the bosphoros. Strange a hotel 5 stars like Kempinski not having thought about the guests peace and tranquility. They should considere changing all the windows facing the street.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Setting, Average and Impersonal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DiscerningTraveler99
Reviews.Content: The Ciragan Palace is on the Bosphorus, some distance by taxi from the main tourist areas. It has a beautiful setting but it feels like a large, impersonal hotel. Our room was nice although a bit dated with a very old TV and dÃ©cor that needed updating but it overlooked the old palace with a deck and a partial view of the Bosphorus. It is lovely to sit at the restaurant and have a drink and watch the ship traffic. Note that food and drink at the Ciragan is very expensive (probably because there are no other options in walking distance). If I chose to stay on the Bosphorus in the future, however, I would probably stay at the Four Seasons instead as it is a smaller hotel and I think that the service would be better. The Ciragan felt a bit like a convention hotel (there was a convention going on while we were there) and the staff was nice but not top-notch. The breakfast buffet is outstanding and not to be missed although it is quite expensive so be sure that you have a room rate that includes breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Bosphorus Views and Promenade”
Reviews.Author: LiveAmused
Reviews.Content: I must start by saying that for the first time travelers to Istanbul, staying by the Bosphorus is not the best idea. I recommend staying in Sultanahmet area where you can walk to most important/historic attractions. We neither liked or disliked this hotel. It has old world grandeur but I thought it was a bit too much of it in a fake-way. On the other hand, the grounds and promenade right on the Boshphorus and next to the Ciragan Palace (which houses one of the hotel's restaurants) is amazing. The service is fine. The concierge staff are polite but not terribly helpful. We were upgraded to Jr. Suite with river views which was nice. The baths are updated and comfortable. We also dined at Tugra, hotel's award winning restaurant housed in the Ciragan Palace wing. The food was good but not memorable, although the atmosphere was. I also enjoyed a relaxing message at the Spa during our stay. This hotel is next door to Four Seasons Boshphorus. There is a pretty park across the hotel and the ferry stop is 15 min. away by walking. However, for visit other tourist attractions, one must use cabs or perhaps the Metro. Bottom line, Ciragan Palace Kempinski is a good luxury hotel choice for staying a night or maximum of 2 in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Magical!”
Reviews.Author: NoelCapp
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this as a couple. Our first time away from the kids in a long time and we weren't disappointed. We loved the atmosphere, the pool and the views were incredible. Outstanding service and accomodations. Only negative was the distance from the Olde City but well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Great place! From The Sultan Brunch though... all is left is an Azap's snack”
Reviews.Author: Hermes-Ro
Reviews.Content: We've spent yet another weekend in Istanbul, one of our favorite destinations for a fun, wining-dining-shopping few days. A great city and wonderful people! Our favorite hotel, Ciragan Palace Kempinsky did not dissapoint us at all this time with their courteous service, elegant welcoming, fantastic Bosphorus view rooms, excellent concierge expertise, lavish breakfast and this "je ne sais quoi" which makes the difference between good and excellent. And this is probably the 5th or 6th time we have stayed here over the last 10 years. Always right! It's not easy to keep doing the right thing over and over. I know it very well, especially in this industry. It doesn't come cheap at all (The Super De Luxe Double Bosphorus view is 1,350 Euros in off peak season) but the room is really luxurious and the view unique and breathtaking! i have attached a few photos just so you understand what I'm talking about. I would congratulate in particular the airport limousine transportation staff, the front office manager, Mrs Gulsen, and the whole team of concierges for their outstanding service. Two things I would attract attention on that may need some review. At the price you guys sell the room, that TV is a shame, really! it's the smallest and cheapest I have seen in a long time. you should do something about it, really. and the brunch, once famous for the variety and richness, is a pale image of what it once was. Gone are the meat grills, the kebaps, the baked lamb, rotisserie chicken... In fact the only difference between a regular breakfast and "The Sultan's Brunch" is a table with very poorly cooked seabass baked in salt and an uninviting piece of roastbeef. While at breakfast sparkling wine flows freely, at brunch, which is double in price, is one glass per person. A nonsense if you will. Crisis must of hit hard the owners because the reductions are drastic, visible and exaggerated.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: PD1412
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for work, as we are hosting a conference here later in the year, but managed to squeeze in some relaxation too. The hotel is simply stunning. The location is perfect - on the banks on the Bosphorus. Room was beautiful - super comfy bed, and everything you could want provided. Fabulous bathroom with lovely robes, slippers and toiletries. Breakfast is delicious- probably about 200 things to choose from, but I never did discover what 'Foul Madam' was. There is a juice batr with 10 different juices to choose from. Ate at BBQ restaurant one night - outside by the Bosphorous - which was great. Staff are very friendly, and nothing seems to too much trouble. Pool and spa are beautiful. Only down side - everything is very expensive but I guess you get what you (or your company) pay for and here that is a lot. Now just need a big fat pay rise so I can come back on holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Irene060
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights after one night in Sultanahmet. We made the right choice - one night in the busy hustle and bustle of the old city and then two nights relaxing on the Bosphorus. We didn't go back to the old town once we'd arrived at the Kempinski but just explored further up the coast - Bebek, Sariye - both places worth seeing with Chilai a good restaurant to go to in Bebek. It's a day and evening place so why not let one just run into the other. The Kempinski is a wonderful hotel, great location and very helpful staff. Nothing was too much trouble. The bars were good fun - liked the Fumoir at night and breakfast was excellent - buffet but all different types of foods. I think they were having an Indian wedding the day we left as that morning there was a new breakfast table offering curries and similar. How clever of a hotel to consider who is staying at their hotel and cater for their tastes. Well done Ciragan Palace Kempinski and we look forward to visiting you again.

Reviews.Title: “sensational!”
Reviews.Author: Fernandahf
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful, by the Bosphorus, all rooms have sea view, great service, awesome breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “It's a real palace-you would feel like a royal family.”
Reviews.Author: sek89
Reviews.Content: Just came back from the hotel after staying a week. My husband had conferences there so I and my 9 year old daughter had to spend the whole time ourselves.The breakfast buffet was nice with lots of choices but since my daughter eats very little in the morning, we sometimes had continental breakfast in our room which was also delightful.The garden and the palace next to the hotel is a sight to visit.When we visited Dolmabahce Palace, my dauther said, "Gee,it's just like our hotel!".The swimming pools are nice, especially the outdoor one facing the Bosphorus.Unfortunately, the hotel does not provide shuttles from/to downtown or anywhere else, so you always have to grab a taxi to get somewhere and you have to be really careful about the fares. Some drivers would manipulate the fares and the numbers suddenly change! It often happens especially when you are in tourist areas such as Blue Mosque and Agia Sophia. So here is one tip I found useful. When you are in those areas and want to get back to the hotel, get on a tram next to Agia Sophia(it costs only 1.75tl per adult and kids are free!) and get off at the last station where you can take metro, which costs the same, to Taksim. From there, it costs only 10 tl to the hotel by taxi. Otherwise, it costs around 50 tl.Other than that, the hotel was full of pleasures with kind staffs and beautiful sorroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Can never go wrong with Kempinski Hotels”
Reviews.Author: buddhawise7
Reviews.Content: i came here with my wife on our 1 year wedding anniversary for a 2 week tour of Istanbul and turkey. While in Istanbul we stayed at Ciragan Palace, in keeping with the tradition of staying at Kempinski hotels everywhere we go (which is alot of kempinski hotels in alot of places) we booked a 5 day stay here while we were in Istanbul. i can't say anything that has not been said before: it is truly a grand experience, and the hotel is magnificent. pricey, but totally worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute luxury”
Reviews.Author: jande_9
Reviews.Content: I attended a work conference at this hotel. It is truly amazing luxury. My room had an incredible view, although it was rainy and I had sadly no time to enjoy it. The service was excellent. My only complaint in the conference area of the hotel - the palace - it was very hard to find your way around. The signage was hard to find and getting to the right floor was a challenge. You will live it up in this hotel, but since it is quite pricey, you will feel like you deserve it!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel with fascinating history and modern comforts.”
Reviews.Author: GBoote
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two most enjoyable days in this lovely hotel, with all its history combined with superb modern day comforts. Dunya Taskin, director of guest relations, was extremely helpful and professional. For her nothing was too much trouble and she even helped us several weeks after our trip with an insurance matter.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding, but not cheap”
Reviews.Author: DarrenHK
Reviews.Content: An outstanding hotel in all aspects except the value. I understand Istanbul being an expensive destination nowadays but the rates we had to pay at this hotel (corporate special) left a bitter taste in our mouth, even if it wasn`t my money I spent but rather the company`s. Service and friendliness of the employees was impressive though.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Porthos77
Reviews.Content: The hotel was expensive but it was perfect from beginning to end and well worth it. The room was spacious and the bed was very plush and comfortable. The view of the Bosphorus was stunning. In my experience, this was the best of the 5 star hotels I have stayed in. Room service was there in less than 5 minutes when I requested an adapter. Impressive for a hotel this size. Staff was incredibly friendly and there was never any signs of haughtiness. The most impressive thing I noted was that when hailing a cab, the hotel would tell us (and the taxi cab driver) how much it should cost to our destination so we would not be taken advantage of. They always noted the taxi cab number and handed us the hotel business card so we could show any taxi driver and be able to return to our hotel. Needless to say, this made us feel very safe and it is this level of detail and caring that makes this hotel stand out from all others. I cannot recommend this hotel more highly.

Reviews.Title: “Sultan living”
Reviews.Author: gigilalala
Reviews.Content: What better than a staying for a few days on a real ottoman palace!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel. Excellent service. Excellent restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: travelfromportugal
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the park of an old (rebuilt) palace, where the restaurant is located. High quality of service. The restaurant is somewhat pricey but worth a visit, especially with a table looking at the Bosphorus.

Reviews.Title: “The best service!”
Reviews.Author: elv16
Reviews.Content: One of the most beautiful hotels I have stayed! The service as 7 star hotel, food is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Lush Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hilaliya
Reviews.Content: From the impressive mazing breakfast buffet overlooking the lake to the sumptous rooms, aided by a friendly, hospitable staff, I highly recommend this hotel. I would like to highlight the amazing work by the Director of Guest Relations, Ms. Dunya Taskin, always patient, hard-working, the epitome of professionalism. She is a real asset to this great hotel. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Surpasses Kempinski standards”
Reviews.Author: cordelia11
Reviews.Content: At the top of the Kempinski portfolio of hotels - I was continually pleased with the friendliness and attention to detail. If you are willing to spend the money for this very pricey hotel, you will not be sorry. I stayed two nights and it was simply terrific.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in Besiktas”
Reviews.Author: elmasgrande
Reviews.Content: Taking out the first impression where your bags and yourself are screened (then I learned that it's done everywhere in Istanbul), this hotel is sensational. The rooms are big, the mattress is comfortable and there is free high speed wi-fi in the whole hotel. The hotel has a nice view to the Bosphorous and is located in Besiktas area -a safe area, but in order to go anywhere (Taksim, Levent, Cihangir, etc.) you will have to take a "taksi". The tv was very low quality and the hotel can be really expensive if one has to pay the bill -the breakfast costs 48 Euros (!). Tip: Have breakfast 6 blocks away -walking towards the Besiktas stadium, you'll find a couple of good places. Tip II: If you happen to eat downstairs in the hotel itself, beware of a trick: They'll offer you in carefully bad English 4 oysters for YTL 14 (around 10 USD). When the check comes, they will have charged you four times that amount (USD 10 per Oyster), contrary to the previous explanation. So, either you should avoid trying the oysters, or you should make it clear in advance what the deal is. At 5 pm every day they bring good complimentary Turkish delights, try them.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all what I expected”
Reviews.Author: Sev8196
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week in november. I chose it because its very beutiful the architecture and is on the bosphorus. The food and accomadations were so expensive especially for Turkey. The food and breakfast was the same story. I had to wait a long time to check in too

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking view and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: HJ1974
Reviews.Content: We went to Istanbul for 10 days, we stayed in grand deluxe room and we absolutely loved our room and the panoramic view and balcony. Everything in this hotel is just perfect from the room service, restaurants, sitting area outside, swimming pool, etc. I seriously cant find anything wrong! Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: happygirl001
Reviews.Content: It is hard to find the right words to review this hotel: it is the best hotel ever with the greatest service that one could imagine. The hotel is located directly on Bosphorus, so you can enjoy the wonderful view - book a room with at least a partial view, it is definitely worth the money. it is not directly in the old town, so you have to use a car to go downtown, but to my opinion it is much better to stay on Bosphorus than downtown. Rooms are clean, very inviting and comfortable. The hotel itself is beautiful - a real palace, with a very long corridors though. Food in all the restaurants is just a dream, dining right on the Bosphorus in the grill restaurant is a must and unforgettable experience, as all of the other restaurants too, we tried them all and the food was nothing but excellent. Be sure that you have the braekfast in the hotel, a great choice of the most tasteful things you could have. Service is perfect from the bell boy, through waiters (serving in white gloves) to housekeeping. Check in was done in the room, Concierge organized the best guide. We also tried Hamam treatment in the hotel Spa, it was good, even though I did not get correct introduction to the procedure from the Spa reception, so my treatment was a bit spoiled. This is one of the best city hotels in the world, and I will definitely come back, even just for the hotel itself and its perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Low class service in dealing with 'missing' item from room”
Reviews.Author: nrggirlnyc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Kempinski for three nights in September 2010 prior to a cruise. The hotel was beautiful, the rooms were amazing...but then an unfortunate thing happened. A cashmere wrap that had been left in my room one evening was no longer where I had left it, and indeed, wasn't in the room at all. We called to the front desk and were told to wait for a call back from someone. We waited over an hour - no call. We called again. Finally someone decided to send security up and said they would want to search our room...which we thought a bit odd, since a) we had already done that and b) it seemed like a lack of trust and invasion of privacy. Security and an assistant manager I believe came up with the housekeeper and indeed said they would like to search our room. When we pushed back and said that was offensive, they said they didn't need to and we could continue with the report. However, you can see how that would go....deniying a search that gave them an easy out. So we let them go through all of our bags, our drawers and our closet. It was very odd and extremely uncomfortable. We were told several times that they have never had an instance of theft at the hotel. We were like, well that's nice, but we have something missing. They insisted I must have left it somewhere, or misplaced it. I insisted it had been in the room since day 1. We filled out a report, and never heard from anyone again. At check-out, we were sure someone would mention it at the desk as surely someone would have written something about the instance in our record. Nope. Nothing. My husband demanded a manager - we got another assistant manager who knew nothing of it and after much back and forth agreed to bring the head of security down to speak with us. We also asked for a copy of our report to bring home with us. He again told us they had never had any theft - and that they searched the laundry and asked all of the cleaning staff about my wrap. They had found nothing (go figure - who would admit to taking something!?). They basically said the case was closed and we must have misplaced it somewhere. We thought that this was an incredibly unprofessional way to handle the matter. We never asked for any compensation, but you would think that the hotel would have tried to do something about it. We hadn't claimed to have lost the Hope Diamond after all. The assistant manager did take a breakfast off of our bill (I think more because my husband and I were throwing a fit about it at the front desk), but there was never an apology and we never heard anything further. We were very displeased with that experience and thought it was not befitting of a five star luxury hotel with the price tag that the Kempinski has.
