As my husband said, we were treated as if we were at a hostile somewhere. Even a budget hotel wouldn't have dealt with the matter in that manner. So, we're here to tell you that although they won't admit it, there is theft at the Kempinski. Otherwise, there are ghosts stealing $400 cashmere wraps.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection on the Bhosporus”
Reviews.Author: kissthesunsetpig
Reviews.Content: If you are bothering to read a review of this hotel you are either lucky enough for money to be no object or perhaps wondering how a hotel in Istanbul could possibly be worth this price. All i can say in defence of the Ciragan palace is that it is quite simply a superb hotel and more than justifies its high price. Firstly location. It is on the Bhosporus, in the Besiktas neighborhood, which is 5 minutes in a cab or 20 minutes stroll the centre of town. To be able to eat, drink or even swim whilst looking out across the water is really something else. The rooms were of average size, without being anything extraordinary, but were extremely well appointed. A choice of 10 pillows gives you an idea of what to expect, and there is a nightly treat of fresh sweets or chocolates with the turn down service. The main road could be heard from my room even with the window closed, but as a heavy sleeper this is no problem. a light sleeper may prefer to specify a room on the Bhosphorus side. The fitness room and outdoor pool are excellent, although the indoor pool is small. Breakfast is world class. One of the best buffet breakfasts you could imagine anywhere. It is difficult to find fault with this hotel - it really is worth what ypu pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: michaelsackett
Reviews.Content: A fantastic place to stay and the staff where fantatic to deal with, they went the extra yards to make our stay special, high regards for Dunya TaÅŸkÄ±n Director of Guest Relations, who help me out when I needed some help after my stay at the Ciragan. My only complaint would be the price of beers purchased around the pool.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: raroberto
Reviews.Content: My family and I traveled here years ago. We actually dropped off from a boat on the Bosporus. Hotel employees, who had been informed of our arrival were waiting for us on the dock. They treated us like royalty, bringing to mind all the romance of an Istanbul arrival in previous centuries. The service was superb and the atmosphere was wonderful the entire time we stayed. The restaurant took our five-year-old from us and she helped greet customers one nights, allowing my wife and I to have a quiet moment alone. I can't say enough good things about the Ciragan.

Reviews.Title: “ottoman style opulence on the banks of the bosphorous”
Reviews.Author: pickyfella
Reviews.Content: gorgeous hotel in unbeatable location. very relaxing, with good food, shopping and spa. rooms are four out of five, though doubtless that figure will rise when the planned refurbishment takes place. really, really good, without being exceptional. great place in which to escape. everything you'd need is on tap at the hotel, though deep pockets are required.

Reviews.Title: “Posh, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: Mikel_Arteta
Reviews.Content: Obviously very exclusive, and the hotel is great on the details. Gym is fine, pool is fantastic. Service was a bit slow, not many options for food and drink, the aesthetic of the hotel building (as opposed to the palace next door) wasn't great and the view from my room was straight onto the vehicle entrance and the road. Compared to most other hotels in Europe it was a fantastic experience, but to my mind it doesn't justify the prices charged.

Reviews.Title: “The best ever...”
Reviews.Author: RaquelL6
Reviews.Content: To you feel as a dream , the most wonderful place i ever had!Ater know there, you cant forget it! Its better visit site of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great building but vastly overpriced”
Reviews.Author: luxtraveller88
Reviews.Content: The palace and gardens of this hotel are stunning and it's right on the Bosphorous. It is very spacious and has every facility you would expect of a 5 star hotel. However, it is vastly overpriced, the rooms are plush enough but I'd expect better at this price. Eating and drinking in the hotel is outrageously expensive. The location is a long way form the old town, main sights and shopping. It was nice to stay but I might not rush back to this particular hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: DonnaBaker26
Reviews.Content: First I must say I liked this hotel, and my travel agent got us an amazingly good rate considering the posted prices. However, once we arrived we realized the reason our rate was so good was because our room was on the far end of the building adjacent to the street. While our view of the Bosphourous and the bridge was awesome, the traffic noise posed a real problem when trying to sleep. The room was nice, but certainly not what I would consider five star accomodations. And the hotel is far from Old Istanbul, so be prepared to take a taxi to get to the historic sites That being said, we did enjoy our stay here. The staff was very welcoming; the grounds and pool were beautiful; and the buffet breakfast (which was included in our room rate) was amazing! They had something for everyone at the morning stations and champagne to go with it all. We never went hungry, for sure. We also had very good interaction with the bellmen who guided us into taxis and to a pharmacy that we would have never found without their help. Not sure I'd stay here again, but it's a nice place. I highly recommend you pay extra and ask for a room in the middle of the hotel with a Bosphorous view. And if you're looking at their website, you should not that the building you see, which is the Palace next door, is not the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not quite 5 star”
Reviews.Author: hase1
Reviews.Content: i found this hotel pretty average and totally overpriced for what they offer. the rooms are dated, the tv is from the 80s and really small, picture not clear, carpets could be replaced and bathroom is just ok. we got a room with a park view and looked at 2 run down tennis courts and the street. the breakfast buffett is awesome but you also pay 100 euros (2people) for it. the lobby is nice, so are the restaurants, and the location right at the bosphorus is beautiful. however if i pay 450 euros a night for a hotel i would expect the rooms to be up to standard, which they are clearly not.

Reviews.Title: “not happy”
Reviews.Author: taskinyuksel
Reviews.Content: I had a business lunch at the terrace of the Ciragan, and unfortunately there was a FLY (cooked in) the cheescake. the hotel is quitely well situated though, and the service is excellent... Guests are very international and staff is polite/ well educated and forthcoming. The roms are clean, elegant style and big with a nice view. The prices are a little too much for the services proposed, as the spa for instance is not at the highest level.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: Carla1310
Reviews.Content: Besides the wonderful construction, what impressed me most was the care that the staff has for all the guests. I didnÂ´t feel like I was one more guest, the way I was treated made me feel very special.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Halofan1
Reviews.Content: What an amazing place! Everything exceeded our expectations, especially the friendly and helpful staff. We had such a positive experience! Dunya Taskin, the Director of Guest Relations, went out of her way to make a great visit even better from the time we first walked onto the property. She's amazing! If you get the opportunity, the Ciragan Palace Kempinski is a must! Anything they organize for you is done first class!

Reviews.Title: “Beauty Grace and Charm on the Bosphorus”
Reviews.Author: indytravelgirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not to be missed. There is no other place to stay. and I am a big fan of Four Seasons generally, but the Ciragan is absolutely the best choice for this area with it's stunning architecture and history. So many people have waxed poetic about the morning breakfast buffet, so I will skip that- suffice to say I agree that there is a plethora of choice and the magnificence of it is quite stunning. Bring an appetite and plan not to eat the rest of the day. The personal greeting at the door on arrival (did they have my photo on file already?!) and the in-room check in was a lovely and much appreciated touch. How refreshing to be taken to our suite so that the children could explore whilst we dispensed with the formalities in the comfort of our room. The childrens' photos were taken and sent back up to our rooms framed and ready to take home before we had unpacked our first bag. Everything we desired was anticpated and supplied before we had time to say. We are spoiled certainly in our travel experiences, but our children and my elderly father so enjoyed the Turkish hospitality provided that we vowed to return before long. What overwhelmingly gracious staff, a great location, we came back to the calm and tranquility of our hotel after full sight-seeing tours (organised perfectly by the hotel ) Just superb.

Reviews.Title: “The service is incredible just the best...”
Reviews.Author: Womat2000
Reviews.Content: The service is incredible just the best, the view it is just fantastic as you can see the bosforus infront of you and the ottoman building next to the hotel this is like a dream. Food was great and the breakfast was impressive all sort of tiles of food and all very well presented. The rooms where nice but the need to be refurbish soon as the tv was old and the internet conection was very bad

Reviews.Title: “Ciragan Palace Kempinski is excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Dasha555
Reviews.Content: We having stayed in Ciragan Palace Kempinski last week and it was unforgettable. This is a fabulous hotel with wonderful atmosphere, very elegant with beautiful interiors. We enjoyed it from the first to the very last minute. This hotel is a true 5 star hotel and absolutely faultless. Every member of staff whom we came in contact with was not only friendly and approachable but very efficient, too. It is a great five star hotel with a nice and friendly atmosphere in every corner, from the desk to the restaurants. All facilities and outlets are on a good level. The service of the staff is impeccable. They are very methodical in their manner of working. They are friendly and always keen to help. The staff is really professional. Especially Iâ€™m so grateful to staff in BBQ Lounge & Laledan such as Gokhan, Ayhan, Aslihan, Mustafa, Khris,Yagmur,Ali Naci,Rucha, Cem and hostesses as well Lutfiye & Gozde. They were so attentive and careful. BBQ & Breakfast were so delicious. Selection of food was great. We have stayed in many 5* hotels but with all honesty can say that we didnâ€™t see variety of food like there. Swimming pool was amazing, the Bosphorus view was so beautiful. Thanks to Security Officer Omer Bozagan for his care during our stay beside swimming pool, also to Oran Kuarabulat for his great job. Also to Spa Russian speaking employee for useful information about hotel facilities. Ciragan Palace Kempinski is the best place to stay, perfect for a relaxing break. We were most impressed with the hotel and the extraordinary attention to detail, we found it hard to come up with any kind of idea to improve on what they already have done. We had a fantastic stay at the hotel and will not hesitate to recommend it to anyone who would like to have an unforgettable holiday. Definitely weâ€™ll come there again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding experience”
Reviews.Author: gorgeousgray
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded our expectations, which were high. The architecture and decor were beautiful, the room lovely and comfortable. The Tugra restaurant was beyond wonderful -- food, service, wine. Particularly excellent service was provided by Dunya Taskin, Director of Guest Relations. I can't express in words how warm, courteous, and helpful she was -- a great asset to the staff of the hotel. In all, a memorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Istanbul but”
Reviews.Author: skurf
Reviews.Content: It is the fifth time I come to this hotel and I am never disappointed great infinity pool and very comfortable rooms it is ideally located between besiktas and ortakoy close to Dolmabahce a new bar le fumoir has opened the massage on the bosphorus is a must yet I was disappointed to see that guests to the pool are charged - ridiculous price above 150 euros - I had a friend who came to see me at the pool and the staff did not want to let him without paying the entrance fee - so we had to go the coffee shop to discuss - ridiculous again and the lady in charge was really harassing us

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: Saira_k
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself stayed at Ciragan Palace last year in October 2009, and had a wonderful experience. The staff there is extremely hospitable and friendly. So we decided to take our daughter again this year. I have to stay that it is a place with a class and style of its own. Its a complete luxury experience which is facilitated by each and every staff member. Not is the view breath taking, the services including the 24 hour gym, the turkish Hamman, the spa experience, and the personalized customer serivce is worth mentioning. Once again, our experience at Ciragan Palace exceeded our expectations. I would highly reccomend booking through the guest relation manager, Dunya Taskin, who went out of her way to accomodate our needs and make us feel comfortable to the extent that it felt like home. Even though I have stayed there twice, if I were to visit Istanbul again, Ciragan Palace would be my only choice.

Reviews.Title: “is the last palace built by the Ottoman Empire for the royal family.”
Reviews.Author: SRBAEZ
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good in front of Bosphorus , has a great pool and spa, but exorbitant prices for breakfast ( 48 Euros) , and very expensive prices for food and drinks The hotel is awesome , very beautiful , try to get a package that includes breakfast as I saw nothing close to have a meal The hotel restaurant is very beautiful and besides the price worth a visit, outstanding view and 1st class service

Reviews.Title: “Utterly Amazing: Captures the Essence of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: emc8760
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon and cannot recommend this hotel more. We were choosing between this and the Four Seasons, and our travel agent said that the Ciragan Palace is very romantic because it's a former Ottoman palace right on the Bosphorus. We definitely made the right decision. The rooms are gorgeous (make sure you get one facing the Bosphorus) with wonderful amenities (big tubs, treats brought to the room every day, etc.), and service is excellent. The gym also rocks, and the pool is insanely beautiful. We opted not to get breakfast bc it's much too expensive (50 euros per person per day), so we'd walk a few blocks to buy simit (these sesame bagel type things that everyone eats). Amazing experience! (One more tip: book a Turkish bath from Les Ottomans, a nearby hotel; it was the most special experience of our trip)

Reviews.Title: “Extremely friendly staff, very attentive, this makes the hotel extra great”
Reviews.Author: lionelnijs
Reviews.Content: Been here for business trip. I had a room with park view (this side is perhaps a bit noisy because it's close to the street). If you book and you have the coice, don't look at the little surcharge and go for the one with the view, it makes it double worth it. Staff is always friendly, not too pushy but just very helpfull in any way you can imagine. Also almost all staff speaks English (which isn't the case in all hotels in Istanbul) The whole atmosphere in the hotel is very relaxed. For breakfast, certainly try the Luleda restaurant, buffets everywhere and you can sit outside with a magnificent view on the Bosphorus. Would recommend !

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Travel127121
Reviews.Content: This hotel is spectacular, beautifully decorated and large enough not to feel closed in after a week. Service is extremely attentive wherever you go. Food is presented to please the eye, and tastes as good as it looks. Everything from traditional Turkish food to great American. The spa and gym equally nice.

Reviews.Title: “A true palace”
Reviews.Author: beam1
Reviews.Content: The lack of centrality is more than made up for by the beauty of the hotel and it's location right on the Bospherus. The rooms are beautiful with absolutely every imaginable amenity. The breakfast is great satisfying every diet and taste. The staff is wonderful, gracious and totally helpful. Pricey, of course but what do you expect from a real palace.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NadiaAz
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in fantastic location. Attentive staff but make sure you know which airport you are travelling to - we got sent to wrong one but made flight with 20 mins to go. However, hotel were very helpful and provided immediate assistance. Gorgeous pool, lovely buffet breakfast. Restaurants worth going to in Istanbul are Sunset and Reina. What a fabulous city.

Reviews.Title: “A journey to the Otoman Empire!”
Reviews.Author: fernandaseabra
Reviews.Content: Ciragan Palace Kempinski is a hotel to remember. I will never forget the days I spent there...The breakfast, the staff, the gardens, the pool, the view from my suite's terrace, the History of this place, etc...Everything about this Palace is amazing. Perfect location...a little far from Sulthanamet but close to Ã–rtakoy, which is the neighbourhood with the best restaurants, shops, etc...not far from Taksim either! The traffic is Istanbul is terrible by the end of the day and you should remember that it's a GREAT IDEA to leave Sulthanamet before 4 o'clock...and go back to the modern side of european Istanbul, where the hotel is located. Ciragan's staff will do everything they can to make your days there unforgettable..and they will be! Of course...the best things in life are not free and everything there is really expensive...there was a 30 Euros Jean Paul Gaultier designed Evian bottle in my room...The Internet Lab has many, many computers and you can leave your laptop at home if you want... I recommend Ciragan to all of my friends and relatives here in Brazil...it's a journey to the Otoman Empire glory!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel, one of the best!”
Reviews.Author: radicalseven
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference and was blown away by the whole thing. Location is a bit out of the way for tourist things (it's a bit of a hike by cab or walk plus tram to the main sights in Sultanahmet). Staff were outstanding. Loved the goodies delivered to the room each day. Conference facilities are very good and the food superb- breakfast was great. Take care with hotel taxi drivers- i got ripped off by one. Room was stunning- looking over the Bophorus, but it would have been good to have more power points for charing various electronic things. An ironing board was also not provided as a matter of course.

Reviews.Title: “Sultan Palace”
Reviews.Author: OttomanCitizen
Reviews.Content: First class hotel, it used to be a palace of sultans. Decoration is Ottoman and sophisticated. Hotel is near to hip nightclubs and local scene, also close to business districts. It isn't so close to old downtown. Magnificient view, next to Bosphorus. Don't stay in street view rooms-you will not enjoy a bit still pay 300$. Go for a Palace room for a couple of grand. It is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “truly one of the world's best!”
Reviews.Author: olli3
Reviews.Content: When in Istanbul, I stay at the Ciragan Palace. Yes, it's not the cheapest place to stay, but definitely the best. Choose a room with sea view and you will surely be fascinated by the Bosphorus view. Any room is pure luxury, with several plasma TVs, handmade carpets and a 24h room service (Booking a suite includes a personal butler and driver.). The breakfast buffet ist just great, including "western" and Turkish food. Ciragan Palace also has marvelous restaurants to eat out at night with a scenic view and an impressive cross-over menu. And don't miss the bar late at night - to enjoy a perfectly prepared drink and illustrous people around. If you have some extra money to spend, turn to the bar's list of drinks and try one of their champagnes or exquisite whiskies.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, Great service”
Reviews.Author: Expat-in-Schweiz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ciragan 10 days in January. We had a room on the third floor facing the Bosphorus. Amazing view, great hotel, good service, wonderful Spa....Can't fault them for much. We had one bad room service which they rectified quickly and the Breakfast buffet can be improved upon. When you have breakfast for 10 days in the same place, you become a regular and you can notice every little fault. Don't miss their high tea. If it's within your price change, I would definetely recommend it. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in service--with a personal touch!”
Reviews.Author: Yumzy
Reviews.Content: A few months ago I spent 3 nights at the Ciragan Palace in Istanbul. I have been traveling to Turkey for the past 20 years, and this was my second stay at the Kempinski. The hotel has undergone a renovation of its rooms in recent years, but one thing has remained the same--the timeless service of the Palace which sets the standard for Turkish hospitality. The hotel staff goes above and beyond duty to provide you with a 5-star service which is both friendly and professional. I was celebrating my birthday, and was warmly surprised with a birthday cake and a thoughtful book about the palace. I was accompanying a larger group who were on official business and the delegation was equally impressed by all the arrangements. Of particular note was the head of guest relations, Ms. Dunya Taskin, who made sure that no details of our stay were overlooked, but also took the time to give me the best tips on where too find all the best stores in Istanbul! Finally...I would recommend the Turkish Hamam at the Spa for any visitor.

Reviews.Title: “Top choice in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: DavidWorldTravel
Reviews.Content: Being a regular visitor to Istanbul and having stayed in most of the five stars, this is clearly something special. Even if the service wasn't as good as it is, the location would make up for it. But the service is perfect and staff make you feel special. The room decoration is a bit old-fashioned but is clearly in line with the overall style of the place.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: stlcruisegirl
Reviews.Content: I'll make this review very simple. There are a number out outstanding hotels in Istanbul, The Ritz-Carlton, the Four Seasons, The Park Hyatt, etc., and they, along with the Ciragan Palace, offer outstanding 5-star accommodations, restaurants, and service. However, just having tea on the patio of the Ciragan Palace, overlooking the Bosphorus, takes your breath away and makes it worth your while to stay here. That's all that needs to be said.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service”
Reviews.Author: Tedandtre
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a week while attending a company conference. The City and hotel are amazing and must be experienced to be appreciated. We had our meetings at the Palace next door and it is a site in itself. The only issue is it is a bit away from the old city so a taxi to the old city or a 20 minute walk to the tram are in order. Rely on the advise of the front desk in terms of restaurant and sites to see.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel with absolutely impeccable, service and hospitality.”
Reviews.Author: HCBoston
Reviews.Content: I am just back from Istanbul and cannot say enough about this hotel. I am a frequent business and leisure traveler, and enjoy staying in better hotels. This is by far one of the best I've ever stayed in. It's a beautiful property with finely appointed rooms and extremely comfortable beds, sheets, etc. Each evening, slippers are set out, next to the bed, along with a sweet treat (including home made Turkish delight). Every detail is attended to, day and night, and the customer service is beyond words. The staff is always on hand with a friendly greeting. Within a day, most knew my name, and greeted me and my business colleagues accordingly. I was so impressed, and felt so welcomed. Though luxurious, there was no snobbism -- the people were warm and friendly, and extremely attentive. By the time I'd left, I felt I had my own personal host in Dunya, one of the managers there. I will, without question, stay there whenever I am in Istanbul and would recommend it to anybody traveling either on vacation or business who enjoys an elegant, comfortable, and beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It does not get better than this!!!!”
Reviews.Author: horadam1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many fabulous hotels, but this hotel tops them all!! It all began with the check-in. We were greeted by name by the valet when we arrived at the hotel. We were quickly taken up to our room without going to a check-in desk. Upon arrival, I notified the concierge that luggage had been left in Cairo by the airline. They stayed on top of it , and got my luggage back to me within 24 hours of my arrival in Istanbul. The room service was flawless! The food was outrageously expensive, but delicious. I would try to get a package where the breakfast is included. We did the large buffet breakfast one morning and it came to $80/person!!! We were traveling around Turkey, and the hotel was willing to store 5 pieces of our luggage while we were flying from one place to another. They did this gratis!!! If you want the best of the best, this is the only place to stay in Istanbul. I want to say that this hotel has a policy of never saying "no."

Reviews.Title: “too good to review”
Reviews.Author: niyalish
Reviews.Content: Dont even think there is any point of writing a review on this palce. its just that good. Whether for work or leisure if you are going to be in Istanbul you HAVE to stay at the ciragan palace. the rooms, the views , the staff everything is top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: Expat93
Reviews.Content: I was upgraded to a Bosphorus room with a little balcony overlooking the water. Stunningly beautiful. The room was roomy and spotlessly clean. The staff at the Ciragan Palace are amazing--I ran out of business cards during my trip and two members of staff made colour copies for me on heavy paper--and hand-cut the cards so that they would be exactly the right size. They didn't even charge me for doing this. Amazing. If you have time, try the hammam treatment. So worth the time and money just to see the hammam room that they use!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: TriantafillopoulouV
Reviews.Content: Amazing view, tasteful breakfast, we totally enjoyed it, I would definitely so again!!!! I couldn't get enough of it !!! Book it without thinking again!

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but somehow Over The Top”
Reviews.Author: AllanGr8
Reviews.Content: You can't get much better than this. My corporate rate was decent, but this hotel is just too good to deserve rating in a value category - if you want to try this, you should do it almost regardless of price.

Reviews.Title: “Top-Notch Hotel. Felt like Royalty."”
Reviews.Author: vcurtis82
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this hotel. I stayed here from October 20 - 23, in a wonderfully appointed and spacious one-bedroom suite. From the moment I stepped through the door I was treated like royalty. The service was impeccable and the hotel was beautiful including the grounds, restaurants, spa and outdoor areas. I hear the Four Seasons, located just down the road, is even more impressive but it is hard to imagine after staying at the Ciragan Palace. If you have time I would highly recommend the Turkish Hammam at the spa â€“what a treat! This hotel is pricey, but if you are looking for a top-notch establishment where you will be pampered this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: IacovosZ
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing. Expensive but worth the experience.

Reviews.Title: “if this is 2nd best what is 1st”
Reviews.Author: Yeshe2
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three days at the Ciragan Palace and it could not have been a more sublime place to visit. It was like being a Sultan. 24 hour butler service and the most romantic atmosphere one could imagine. The private living quarters of the Palace have been converted to a luxury hotel. The food, service, views, rooms where delightful. The best hotel experience we have ever experienced and we travel often throughout the world.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Slow Service”
Reviews.Author: crims0ngirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely beautiful. My room was wonderful, the lobbies are great, the pool area was lovely, and the view of the Bosphorous was outstanding. However, nearly all interactions I had with staff members were extremely slow by American standards. Check-in took half an hour. A request for an item from the front desk took 45 minutes to arrive in my room. Coffee and juice requests at the breakfast buffet took much longer than in even low quality US restaurants. If you want a lovely location and don't mind slow (but friendly) service, I recommend the Ciragan.

Reviews.Title: “If you love infinity pools, this is the hotel for you!”
Reviews.Author: tabarber99
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous pool with Bosphorus and Palace view that is unbeatable! Hard to tear ourselves away to go sightseeing. House wine and cocktails at pool bar cost as much as entrees -- 32 Lira for a glass of house wine so visit duty free if this concerns you. Cab from airport is 20 Euros or so -- cab to Sultanahmet (sightseeing) is around 20Lira. Traffic can be horrendous and it took us an hour to get back to the hotel at midnight on Saturday. Yikes! Gazebo -- restaurant overlooking Bosphorus and pool is fabulous and not horrendously expensive for what it is (25-32 Lira for entrees) with excellent service. Its the drinks that get you! (23-35 Lira each). Booked Superior Bosphorus view at Five Star Alliance for 330 Euro several months in advance (did not include breakfast). Room was lovely with pretty view of Bosphorus over the palms and pool. Very quiet, nice bathroom, super comfy bed, nice balcony. Every night they leave little treats and fruit for you. It was my Bday and they sent a large and very delicious choc cream cake with a candle -- gratis. Make sure you walk to Ortakoy (5 mins walk going left as you leave hotel). Sundays there is an open air market (beads and scarves and trinkets) and the square is reminiscent of the South of France but for the small, beautiful Mosque. Conde Naste traveler's recent article on Turkey has a two page photo of Ortakoy on opening page that shows just how delightful the little town is. Tons of little local places to eat at or try and fall in love with the uber trendy and reasonably priced House Cafe and their fabulous passion fruit martinis. Its a bit hard to find, tucked above the ferry terminal on the far side of the square. Great service and fantastic food. Those worried about location might want to spend a day or two at a hotel in Sultanahmet and then a day or two here to relax by gorgeous pool, see Ortakoy and take Bosphurus cruise, etc. Service good, but a bit slow at times as they are very methodical about making a big fuss over everything. If you ask for ice in the room it comes with a flower in a vase. Details take time. Loved it! Will go back. View simply unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, Business can be Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: SSchwetje
Reviews.Content: Already the first impression upon arrival made my day. The guest relations team welcomed us with the name right after the car door was open. Check in on the room which was fabulous. The Ciragan Palace Istanbul is truly a Palace where you can feel like a majesty. Very traditional but in a contemporary style it is the "place to be" in Istanbul directly at the Bosporus. The variety of Restaurants is amazing and every delight gets served. The absolute highlight is the breakfast buffet and the BBQ place on the terrace directly at the water. The quality and the variety of the food is outstanding as well as the service. Staying there as as business guest I have to admit that i have never been pampered more than in this hotel. Banquet facilities, service are simply outstanding. Highlight here again, the 12 hours ongoing coffee break and private lunch buffet. I highly recommend this hotel to everyone going to Istanbul and I guarantee you the value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Top Property, Top Location, Top Service”
Reviews.Author: ansofitsi
Reviews.Content: Everything is very well taken care of, at the utmost professionalism. Due to its "stiffness" maybe not the best choice for young couples but definitely a visit worth ! The breakfast buffet is an unforgettable experience !! One of the best Hotels in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more for the price”
Reviews.Author: Traveller94115
Reviews.Content: The CIragan Palace is a beautiful hotel, but with definite pros and cons. - Good location for spending time with friends in Bebek, Besiktas, and Ortakoy, not a great spot for sightseeing as it is not close to Sultanahmet. - Free wireless internet. However, the internet only worked in my room about 20% of the time. - The infinity pool is BEAUTIFUL and the best part of the hotel. - At 50 euro, the breakfast buffet is insanely overpriced. - I had to switch rooms three times before I found one that didn't reek of smoke...and it still smelled pretty bad! - The garden view rooms are small and not particularly nice. Overall, it's a very nice hotel, but very expensive and I expected more for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Relax after the sights”
Reviews.Author: richardregatta
Reviews.Content: After 4 nights in the Old City (garden house hotel) and seeing the main sites, it was heaven to enter this palace of luxury. First class service, friendly and everything you would expect from 5 star -Yes including prices. Don't stay in a luxury palace and moan about the prices! OK breakfast is a bit steep- maybe highest ever recorded? 48euros but like us youc an walk 10 minitues into Ortakoy where you have the Uber trendy Housecafe or a multitude of Turkish cafes.

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing hotel iÂ´ve ever been!”
Reviews.Author: InesR
Reviews.Content: Expensive but worth it! A bit far from the old part of the city but itÂ´s near the Bosforus and all the nightlife! Very nice staff, confortable and beautiful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A true first class experience”
Reviews.Author: PearlNyc
Reviews.Content: Unsurpassed elegance and service. The infinity pool overlooking the Bosphorus is not to be missed - we went each day after touring - a real delight.

Reviews.Title: “Well Deserved Reputation”
Reviews.Author: QuestForTheBest
Reviews.Content: Rooms-Well decorated, spotless, good product, generously sized Food-Terrace restaurant for snacks was great Buffet breakfast easily compares with Four Seasons buffet brunches Gym/Spa-Adequate. The Manager should be retrained and/or replaced as is true of much of the eqiptment. Staff overall was excellent-Elena is a gem. Pool is beautiful and spotless Decor is great throughout all public areas.

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: LuxTravelLover
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed 3 nights at the Ciragan Palace and we could not have been more pleased. This was our second trip to Istanbul in the past year. Last summer we stayed at the Four Seasons on the Bosphorus. Don't get me wrong, the Four Seasons was excellent (see my review of the same), and indeed, we were a bit concerned that the Ciragan would not be as lovely, but we wanted to try some place different, so we decided to try the Ciragan, and we are so glad we did! As nice as the Four Seasons is, we believe the Ciragan is even better and we definitely preferred the Ciragan. First, our check in was one of the most pleasant I've ever experienced. Our hostess, Elana, greeted us, sat us in the lobby, and quickly went through the check in process. She was friendly, courteous, and efficient with both the room check in and in helping us reserve in a couple of the Ciragan's restaurants. Speaking of restaurants, we ate at both Turga and at the Ciragan "BBQ" on the Bosphorus both were fantastic. The BBQ venue cannot be beat (even by the four seasons out door venue), and the food was plentiful and all was delicious. The BBQ manager was also lovely and seemed genuinely concerned that our dining experience was everything it could be. Turga was also fantastic. I read one review on here prior to our trip that praised the atmosphere of the restaurant, but that commented that the food was good, but not great. That was not our experience. The venue is absolutely magnificent, but the food was equally so! Last, but not least, breakfast: our room rate included breakfast each morning at Laledan and what a treat that was! The breakfast is a sumptous buffet. Everything was delicious and the staff were, again, friendly, courteous, and efficient. As for the rooms, our room was a standard one and I really don't think the photos on the hotel's website do these rooms justice, because I was pleasantly surprised when we were shown to our room by Elana. The room was large, well appointed, supremely comfortable, and highly satisfactory. Also I have to disagree with another traveller's review that commented that the hotel looked a bit shabby. We did not find this at all. True, the tvs in the room are not flat screens, but this is very unimportant to me and such a minor flaw in an otherwise flawless presentation. The pool area is also lovely and larger than that of the four seasons. It was quite crowded the day we arrived, but we still had no problem finding two deck chairs, and the staff at the pool were very helpful and quick with orders. Finally, I would be remiss if I didn't mention the gentleman who helped us book a tour on the Bosphorus during our stay. A tour company keeps a desk in the lobby and Mr. Sarioglu helped us book a fantastic tour. He gave us many options, did not try to push us towards any of the more expensive options, and was extremely helpful, even personally escorting us via car to the close-by port for our departure! I really feel like I've been gushing during this review, but we have stayed at many wonderful and luxurious hotels and, truly, the Ciragan really impressed us. Indeed, we plan to highly recommend the Ciragan as a venue for a wedding friends of ours are planning fro next summer. Top notch service, food, and atmosphere--what more could you ask for?!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views but a bit disappointing”
Reviews.Author: DeemarieSingapore
Reviews.Content: Recently spent our anniversary at the Ciragan Palace Kempinski in Istanbul (27 June - 1 July). The hotel has beautiful grounds and a lovely pool area--with an unmatched view right on the Bosphorus,but the hotel itself felt a bit shabby, in need of a more current update. The rooms are spacious and all have balconies, but for the prices being charged, we expected more modern conveniences, like a modern shower and a flat screen TV. Our room had a small TV (not flatscreen), not much bigger than our computer modem at home, no DVD player, and no stereo/radio! For a 5+star hotel, this is the required minimum these days! Bathroom had a shower curtain and an old fashioned shower head. Looking back at the hotel from the pool, the hotel balconies reminded us of an old US Motel chain--the balconies don't seem to go along with the rest of the decor. The attention to detail on service was also a bit disappointing, as we had told them it was our anniversary, but instead we were presented with a small cake that said, "happy birthday"! There is good competition in the area, so visit here but don't stay if you have a choice!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Chisinau1
Reviews.Content: It was my second stay over there. Excellent food; Fabulous view of the Bosphorus+nice swimming pool Good service

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location at a price!”
Reviews.Author: Schmitti21
Reviews.Content: Spent several nights over the last months at this hotel (as it's the preferred choice of my colleagues). As highlighted before, the hotel's location and, in particular, the swimming pool is phantastic right at the Bosphorus. However, the rooms are somewhat old-school and nothing special in terms of design; same is true for the indoor pool and fitness area, i.e. in the basement and on the small side. Staff can be very friendly, but also a bit snobby from time to time ... it all depends with whom you are dealing. Food & drinks are very expensive (e.g. buffet breakfast at â‚¬48) and the quality of dishes not justifying the high price tag. Overall nice experience, but probably would not stay here when traveling for leisure purposes...

Reviews.Title: “Bosphorus to your heart's content”
Reviews.Author: watercolorsky
Reviews.Content: Ciragan Palace Kempinski is a luxurious way to enjoy the breathtaking view of the Bosphorus. I never got tired of sitting in the balcony of my room watching ships go by. Their breakfast and afternoon tea come with champagne and are very fine and elegant. We also enjoyed our dinner at Tugra, the signature restaurant, which is in the annex that was once a sultan's palace. It is a beautiful place to spend an evening although I must say the dishes there were not as memorable as the ambience. Another good place to be is the beautiful pool overlooking the Bosphorus, but unfortunately when we were there, it was too cold to have a swim outside. So we used the inside pool and jacuzzi which were small but cozy. If you stay at Ciragan Palace Kempinski, don't plan too much outings. Spend a lot of time inside the hotel and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: atanna
Reviews.Content: The Ciragan Palace hotel has an almost regal feel to it. Service is exceptionally personalised, with every guest being treated as if one is staying at the owner's home. The Hotel is expensive, but almost fittingly appropriate for the setting and experience. The location on the Bospherous is perfect, with stunning views of the strait from the back of the hotel. The Four Seasons, which is next door, may have more modern gadgets, but it lacks the charm and culture of the Ciragan. In any review of the Ciragan, one must mention the swimming pool - a magnificent setting. This is the only place to stay in Istanbul...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely but expensive”
Reviews.Author: o2travels
Reviews.Content: We arranged our family stay here while we had a dinner at the palace site. Overall a really lovely hotel with very friendly and attentive staff. Given its world class status and price per room however one tends to expect even more. One critism I have to bring is about our dinner. We arranged the dinner of 15 people a month before only because we wanted to have a Bosphorous view. Unfortunately, we were informed only a day before the view was obstructed becase of a party planned for the next day. If we had known this in advance, in all likelihood we had arranged the dinner and rooms next door at the brand new Four Seasons. The only reason we have preferred Ciragan was because Four Seasons restaurant does not have a view. Other than that, the restaurant and hotel staff was extremely nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: chr_8
Reviews.Content: Rooms have lovely views of the Bosporus and the breakfast buffet is extensive with something for virtually every taste. Be sure to eat in the restaurant in the palace where both the food and service are outstanding. Not very convenient to top tourist sites; cabs can take forever in rush hour. The park across the street is lovely and worth a visit. The concierge was not always available and on occasion gave incorrect information. The pools are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “worth every dime”
Reviews.Author: davekv
Reviews.Content: There is no fault that can be found for this hotelâ€¦.truly World Class. Probably the best service and most comfortable hotel Iâ€™ve ever had the pleasure to enjoy (and Iâ€™m old and have stayed in a lot of fine places.) The other reviews say it all and I just want to write about one thing that I think is misstated in some of the other reviews and that is the cost for items outside of the room. Based on my experience, some of the other reviews are overblown. In particular, the person who said a glass of beer was $24. That is nonsense. The MOST expensive beer was 24 Turkish liras which is about $12. While that isnâ€™t cheap, it is in line with other truly world class 5 star hotels. The prices are high but in line with comparable properties. Importantly, what sets Ciragan apart from others is the fine attention to detail. For example, when room servcie delivered breakfast, they delivered a toaster with it so the toast would be hot. Every evening there was a beautiful plate of Turkish Delight candy instead of just a mint on the pillow. Nice touches and there are many of them in this hotel. The Ciragan isnâ€™t Motel 6 and the room rates and food costs reflect that. I am a very cost conscious person who looks for bargains and am outraged by high prices. But, this place was worth every dime.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location right on the edge of the Bosphorus”
Reviews.Author: bobd72
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ciragan Palae with my wife during a long weekend to Istanbul...Istanbul itself is an amazing place and is one of the best long weekends in Europe...It is filled with buildings from different historical periods (Byzantine, Ottoman, Modern Turkish, sometimes in the same building)...Along with Rome, it is the most historical and culturally interesting city I have visitied...The hotel itself in located about 10-15 minute from the Golden Horn on site that includes a restored Ottoman Palace along with a modern hotel built in a similar style....There are beautiful gardens and a pool that is right on the edge of the Bosphorus...You can sit by the pool and watch the ship make their way up and down the Straight...Our room had a balcony overlooking the Bosphorus (definitely worth the extra money) and was comfortable...The decor was nothing special...The spa and fitness center were very good...The breakfast buffet was amazing and the formal restaurant, Tugra, was very good and located in the restored Palace...Subsequent to our stay there have been new hotels that have opened on the Bosphorus (Les Ottomans and the Four Seasons) which are supposed to be excellent...I would definitely recommend staying on the Straight and not in the Golden Horn...It allows you to have some extra space and to relax on beautiful grounds in between sightseeing trips.

Reviews.Title: “Ouch!But a great experience”
Reviews.Author: ARDNAHOE
Reviews.Content: This is the antithesis of a " Midnight Express" experience of old 'Stamboul (no bad thing, i hear you say!). We "enjoyed" the benefits of a conference rate so were saved the eye-watering room rates. You get an idea of the clientele from the listings of the Satellite TV channels - it takes quite a while to reach the channels NOT serving the Gulf States. Our room was on the garden and by all accounts pretty standard - it still was huge and well equipped tho' lacking much in the way of local touch save for a few prints. But the (many) staff kept it spick and span - you only needed to drop a towel and exit your room to find it replaced and the room tidied again. If your poppa ain't an Emir keep an eye on the charges which quickly mount up. I had (possibly the best ever) massage in the modern hamam and spa in the basement level - but it set me back nearly Â£200 (yes,sterling) and a haircut, shave and manicure left no change from Â£80. The charge added to the latter for some mint tea proffered seemed just a bit OTT. We had some friends join us on the terrace one night and, to my recall, we had two beers, one glass of wine, a coke and two teas...at just over Â£90. But then again, I think the breakfast spread (buffet seems inadequate) was among the best I have seen and tasted (sushi after your eggs benedict, Sir? Of course). Unsurprisingly, they will assume as you are a Westerner staying here you are completely loaded...so even arranging a taxi for the trip in to Sultanhamet can prove expensive. Did I mention this gaff was expensive? Mind you, as you swim in the infinity pool as the big liners and tankers steam up the Bosphorus...you do feel a bit like a Sultan. And that never comes cheap...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: vigilanteviajero
Reviews.Content: A Grand Hotel by all means. Great service, fantastic setting, very nice room. Yyes it is expensive but worth every cent. It is indeed a wonderful hotel that you must enjoy to the fullest. At least a day just to savour and enjoy the hotel is needed. People were very nice and friendly. The outdoor areas of the property are great and the next door palace ...A MUST SEE!! We will definitively return

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very expensive”
Reviews.Author: newlondon1
Reviews.Content: Wow! What a location and what a room. We couldn't believe the view of the Bosporus when we walked into our room. The room itself was luxurious although the bathroom was a little small. One problem--and the reason for no 5 star--two out of the three nights we were there our room was not turned down in the evening. Our meal at Turgan was outstanding. The breakfast buffet has to be seen to be believed. It literaly boggles the mind and you eat looking at the water. If only the rates were 25% lower.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: JimmyN
Reviews.Content: If you want to enjoy a break in Istanbul then this is absolute luxury in the perfect location. I would agree with other reviews that it is pricey in all areas but you donâ€™t have to stay here and you probably get what you pay for. Service is exceptional and the rooms are beautiful. The outside space makes it a real winner. Finally it's almost worth going just for the breakfast - again expensive but well worth it! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but costly”
Reviews.Author: byrneJersey
Reviews.Content: We came off a week long trip on a gulet and were desperate for some luxury which we feel we received. reception staff handle check in in the room and were very efficient. we had a junior suite and connecting double room for the children. both rooms had balconies facing the bosphorus and the palace which forms part of the hotel. rooms were clean, not particularly cutting edge (dated tv etc) but definitely 5 star in quality of finish etc. outdoor pool is a real highlight (actually is 2 pools) and, although busy the pool staff always managed to find beds for us after sightseeing. foodwise: we had a fantastic meal in the Turkish restaurant in the palace. For my 2 daughters the highlight was probably sitting on the balcony there and being able to watch a major Turkish wedding take place below including freworks bieing shot from barges on the bosphorus. very glamorous stuff. food outlets very expensive but this is the case with all of the 5 star restaurants in istanbul. the hotel is some way from the major attractions but we did not find any problem with this as they are only a 20 minute taxi ride or so away and taxis are cheap.

Reviews.Title: “A diamond in the rough”
Reviews.Author: aj07
Reviews.Content: My parents decided to keep the hotel a surprise for our first trip abroad during new years ( and Eid holidays) so we decided to stay in Istanbul for 5 days. When you first pass by the hotel you are in awe as u see this magnificent building. we thought the exteriors was beautiful but going inside our rooms we were quite surprised we had a nice view background drop of turkey that just blows your mind away. I thought that this was all the place had to offer, but the breakfast, i still can taste the watery selection in my mouth! never have i see so many things I practically gained weight just from the breakfast! It was a nice place , although the people there weren't as helpful when it came to reservation it still didn't ruin our amazing five day holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service--Insane Prices!”
Reviews.Author: b-squared555
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Kempinksi-Ciragan in late May of 2008. Luckily, our hotel room itself was paid for by a business client for an event they were hosting. The building itself is nothing special: very concrete and drab. The location of our room was good with a nice view of the pool and then the Bosphorus beyond. Check-in was fine and cordial. The console phone system in the room--which also controls the lights--kept going off and on all day and all night so it would light up in the middle of the night, sometimes waking me up with light and the clicking sound it made. The TV only worked a percentage of the time, usually corresponding with when the phone was acting up. And literally, someone was moving furniture in the room above us at 3:30am the 2nd night we were there for nearly an hour! I don't know if it's a conference room they were preparing or what, but it was terrible trying to sleep with all the lights and noise. The prices were ridiculous. By the pool, a coke cost about $16 USD. A sandwich (very average tasting, and I'm not picky usually) was about $35. We ate at one of the restaurants one night and for those similar prices (about 5 times what you would normally pay for anything), the food was OK, but not special. I'm not against paying for luxury when the experience corresponds, but in this case, there was absolutely nothing to justify the prices. Last, the service in general was terrible. Anytime you needed something from the desk, they seemed bothered, or promised it and it never materialized without follow up. The last day, I stopped at the desk to ask for someone to come get the luggage. Then I went to the room to wait. 20 minutes later, I called because no one showed up while I was sitting doing nothing, so I called down. They apologized and said they would send someone immediately. 10 minutes later, another person called ME and said it was past checkout time and when was I planning to check out! Still no one had come to collect the luggage! In my opinion, for these prices, the customer should be treated like royalty. Again, I am not hugely picky and really never stay in 5-star hotels, so my expectations were that we would have a quality experience for that level of hotel. It did not materialize, and I would NEVER pay to stay there. I have had equally pleasant and much cheaper stays at far lesser hotels. After 2 days, our cost for food and amenities alone was $1000 USD and we had little to show for it but a nice few hours by the pool--which we could have done elsewhere. Last, the hotel is nice on the Bosphorus as it is, but it is not conveniently located in Istanbul and a 15-40 minute dizzying taxi ride in traffic is required to get to most areas of town where you would want to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: locarnelo
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our weekend in cold Istanbul at the amazing Kempinski! Not cheap but well worth spending a bit more....this is a bit of an uninteresting review but we really couldn't find flaw with this hotel, clean, chique, friendly, great service etc everything was high class. Would be nice if it was a bit cheaper, then we would stay there every month! We'll return very shortly!

Reviews.Title: “Please dont waste your money staying here”
Reviews.Author: malini_H
Reviews.Content: Please DO NOT waste your money staying here. It was such a dissapointment. One would imagine the hotel is actually in a palace but its not - its connected t the palace. The palace grounds are beautiful but the inside was rather boring and theres nothing going on there - its really dead!! The hotel itself - is very average for a 5 star hotel that boasts of such beauty and splendor. The rooms are really small and not luxurious at all. The bathrooms are dated - they really need to put some money into their rooms considering the amount they charge. We spent 2 nights here and then moved to the Hyatt which was spectacular. Honestly - its nice being by the Bosphosrus but I would think if you just came and ate a meal here - its enough. Try out otehr hotels liek the Swissotel or the Hyatt which, in my opinion, as far as rooms and service, beat the Ciragan hollow Also the Concierge at the Ciragan is positively dislikable. So snooty and really unhelpful. We asked for him to recommend a really nice, local restaurant - he sent us to a really high end, snooty place with terrible food and service. The concierge at the Hyatt was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: katiewalker
Reviews.Content: A beautiful, elegant and peaceful hotle! I was only there for a weekend on a work trip but the hotle is sheer elegance! Situated right on the Bosphorus seperating Asia and Europe, you can sit by the pool and watch the ships and boats sale by at the waters edge! The turkish baths are a must!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and beautiful views”
Reviews.Author: dublin18
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ciragan for a work related meeting. I enjoyed the stay and would recommend it. The service was exceptional - there were people standing in the lobby all day, just ready to help. At the meeting room, the staff were very attentive and no request was too much trouble for them. Every thing was exactly as we had booked it, and the food was plentiful and very tasty. I had a room with no view, which was a pity - would be worth paying more for the view. But it was a very nice and functional room. Slight problem was that the electricity kept cutting out the evening we were there, but then a generator would kick in and turn on some lights. Free wi-fi was a nice touch too. The location is slightly out of the centre of town, so not perfect for sight-seeing in the old town. However, a 15 - 30 min taxi ride gets you to the old town. Is also the far side of the old town, so with bad traffic can be a pain to get there from the airport (took our group 30 - 90 mins depending on arrival times) Overall a very beautiful setting and very high standards of service - I would recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Poolside”
Reviews.Author: Meheen
Reviews.Content: The palace part of the hotel is stunning as is the poolside. The rooms were of a good size and were generally decent. The service was good but not amazing. Beware of the price of the food around the hotel and from room service. I would definetly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Survival KIt when Airline lost luggage”
Reviews.Author: Digger71
Reviews.Content: Arriving at your hotel in the early hours of the morning following a delayed flight, and with the airline having lost yourluggage is not the best start to any stay. Even worse when you have business meetings starting at 8.30am the next day. However, the staff at the Ciragan Palace surpassed themselves in doing all that they possibly could for me during my time of need. Hearing of my situation at check-in, i was provided with the most grand 'Survival Kit' bag! Classy looking, in a leather-esque fabric - it is almost worth losing your luggage for! Containing toothbrush, razor, Nivea deodorant, all the ususal toiletries, it also provided me with decent short pyjamas (embroidered with the hotel crest), and T-Box tshirt, boxer shorts, and quality cotton socks for the next day. Understanding the plight of the situation, the hotel also provided complimentary laundering of the clothes i was wearing until i could buy more, or my luggage arrived. The next day the concierge team proactively took full control of the situation in making all the chase calls to Istanbul airport on my behalf. They called frequently, and kept me uptodate, and even collected the luggage from the Airport when it finally arrived. All this left me to get on with my meetings, without the burden and stress of trying to resolve the situation myself with a non-native tongue. Needless to say the accommodation, and service throughout the hotel was excellent. Without a doubt I will try to come back again ...for vacation next time. And if my luggage should disappear again, I just hope it happens on the way back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best palace in the world”
Reviews.Author: General13
Reviews.Content: This palace is simply amazing. Staying in this hotel was a dream ! The suite was really beautiful and the view incredible. The staff is perfect, the swimming pool as well. You can't explain how this place is a dream, just a dream ! I recommand this palace to everybody, the best of Istanbul and one of the 10 most beautiful palace in the world.

Reviews.Title: “A dream vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Brasil_Argentina
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ciragan Palace for the last 3 nights of our honeymoon. Seriously, did we feel like royalty! Firstly, the place is beautiful, a tourist attraction by itself. Although most rooms are not in the actual palace but in a building next to week, you truly feel the experience from the decoration to the service, everything was perfect. We arrived super early and our room was ready. We had booked this via our company's travel agency website (business rate) and had expected to get a bad room. However, we were surprised when the sent us to a great room with the Bosphorus view. Perfect room! Spacious, well decorated, nice bathroom (huge!). The bed was a bit on the hard side so we asked for an extra down comforter and it was perfect. That same night we had a bottle of champagne and chocolate delivered to our room with greetings from the manager. Room service was way too pricey so we never ordered anything. Everything else was excellent. Two things you have to do if you go: 1) pay for the tea service in the afternoon - it's pricey but worth it for the experience and 2) swim in the heated infinity pool outside right next to the Bosphorus. We were so glad we chose this place instead of the Four Seasons (which was our 2nd choice). The Four Seasons was cute too (we went to check it out) but the Ciragan was by far a better experience given that it was close to all the nice restaurants and away from the mess that is the old city. You could go do all the sightseeing during the day, but at night you are close to nice areas for dining and going out. This is a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “17 euro's for a beer!”
Reviews.Author: kruz
Reviews.Content: ridiculously pricy ! 17 euro's for a beer in Turkey ! breakfast same story accomodation is ok, but food and beverages are a rip off !

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, beautiful location but $$$$$$”
Reviews.Author: SSHB
Reviews.Content: Amazing service and beautiful location. Thought room rate was resonable for what you were getting, but it is excessively pricey though for room service, drinks by the pool or any meal in any of the restaurants. I am from NYC and am used to expensive but this was too much. Decor was a bit dated and stodgy feeling but nothing beats the cache of saying you went to Istanbul and stayed at the Ciragan Palace. Oh, do not take recommendations from the concierge on restaurants. They sent us to a very overpriced tourist trap that served us very very bland sea food. Stick to the recommendations of Time Out! Also...Went to a wedding during my stay here at the hotel and that was spectacular. Fabulous setting, good food, etc, etc. Good thing I didn't have to foot that bill!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel on Bosphorus - Luxurious, fun and Great Location. Worth the mon”
Reviews.Author: Sparkly*Euro*Peep
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful, luxurious hotel in a wonderful setting on the Bosphorus, with facilities and service and food to match it's 5 star rating. Reception: Large, grand and welcoming which leads you out to the terrace and pool outside which backs onto the ocean. Terrace/Pool area: Fantastic infinity pool that is clean, suitable for swimming and for just clowning around. Excellent pool menu and brilliant service as you tan and watch the ocean go by. The restaurant/bar area is wonderful for sitting around and relaxing. Rooms: Luxurious, large, clean and well-equipped with all the usual luxury quips, minibar, TV, phone etc. All rooms have balconies I believe and these are lovely to sit out on. The bathrooms are large and marbled and very clean and nice toiletries. Rooms are cleaned and serviced twice a day. There is a lovely and well-equipped small gym and excellent spa at the hotel - the Turkish bath is highly recommended! Location: Great location near Ortokan. The sea is in front and taxis are plentiful and cheap to get you around this bustling city. Thoroughly recommend staying at this hotel to enhance your stay in Istanbul, it's worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “good but expensive”
Reviews.Author: robkaryas
Reviews.Content: I ve stayed at the Ciragan for the 2nd time with my wife and my 8 months old son. We had a great time. The location on the Bosphorus is unique and the Palace located next door is beautiful. You can expect the service due by a LHW, though the stuff members do not speak well english. Prices are very high, glass of wine at USD 25, for the chili wine, and USD 32 of the local one. Though, you may have a deal via an agent at USD 400 per day, count another USD 300 for extras...We have stayed in many other LHW, but when you pay the price you look into the details, and they still have to improve some of the services before one could justify paying the price....

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in the world”
Reviews.Author: voyageur Ã  paris
Reviews.Content: This hotel sets the standard for 5 star establishments anywhere in the world. The staff are attentive, yet discrete. The rooms, particularly those with a view to the Bosphoros, are dreamy. The breakfast buffet, with outdoor seating on the terrace overlooking the sea, is one of the best ways to start the day, anywhere! The refinement, understated sophistication, and class of this hotel is perhaps not for New Yorkers who equate casual with the right to clack around marble tiled lobbies in their rubber sandals. The prices are eye-popping for sure, but there is so much to explore in Istanbul that one should really not feel relegated to the hotel restaurants for dinner.... a short walk to OrtakÃ¶y or a short cab ride to Bebek will provide you with you plenty of alternatives!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel at a steep price”
Reviews.Author: usckim01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the last leg of our honeymoon for 4 nights. Although the city traffic hinders the location, the proximity overlooking the Bosphorus makes up for it. Our room was clean and very nice and we didn't run into any problems. I felt the hotel to be slightly stuffy, but that can be unavoidable at expensive hotels that attract snobs. My husband and I are very casual travelers and I felt like people were staring at us in our shorts and flip-flops. Everything was outrageously expensive. I've stayed at many 5* hotels, plus I live in NYC, and I was still in sticker shock. They have the nerve to charge $20 for a beer at the pool bar. We asked the hostess what they served at the buffet dinner hoping she could entice us to spend the $150 pp or whatever it was and she told us they served chicken and salad. Her English wasn't good, so maybe she didn't know how to say lobster and caviar in English, but there was no way I could justify paying $300+ for chicken and salad. We did do afternoon tea on the outdoor terrace and it was very nice and not nearly as expensive as other hotels I've been to. I hope to return, but I don't know if I can justify the cost considering the other options in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool -- Happy Wife -- Slow Traffic to Sultanehmet”
Reviews.Author: Andlovingit
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ciragan Palace about seven years ago and returned this year over Easter with my family. We had a very pleasant stay. The hotel's swimming pool is just a large rectangular pool, but its cleanliness, gentle warmth and stunning Bosporus-side location made it attractive to even the water-averse members of our clan. A definite plus. My wife was happy with the service, decor and comfort. We had a Bosporus view room--expensive, yes, but I think worth the extra groschen. The view out over the Bosporus on moonlit nights was something to remember--quite romantic. As all the guidebooks say, the taxi ride into Sultanahmet from the hotel can be a drag, not only because of traffic jams but also because some of the taxi drivers surreptitiously flip their meters to the higher night rate when they note you are a foreign tourist staying at the Kempinski. Most travellers can afford the higher fare, but it is extremely annoying to feel you are being taken advantage of as a trusting visitor. The municipal taxi authorities would be well advised to put a stop to this my putting timers on the taxi meters that would not allow them to be manually manipulated to the nght fare. Nothing spoils a visitor's impression of a city than to feel like he or she is being ripped off. But I digress. The hotel merits its five stars and charges accordingly for them. It is fully priced. It will be interesting to see how it fares in competition with the new Four Seasons being constructed very near by.
